runners.comment: Runner-up to a promising type at Kempton just after Christmas; may progress further
runners.name: Brave Guest
runners.spotlight: Unplaced all starts on Flat for Jack Channon but has shown an aptitude for hurdling, improving on debut form when runner-up to a promising type at Kempton (2m, good) just after Christmas; may progress further.

runners.comment: Fairly useful on Flat; promising third on hurdling debut; open to lots of improvement
runners.name: Down To Business
runners.spotlight: Showed fairly useful level of form in four Flat runs and made promising start over hurdles when 9l third of ten at Newbury (2m, good to soft) last month, keeping on well having still had plenty to do when not fluent two out; open to lots of improvement; big player in first-time tongue-strap.

runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khans Studs S C
runners.comment: Unplaced on Flat; weakening when falling on hurdling debut; others appeal more
runners.name: Elman
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in three Flat outings for Johnny Murtagh; made some of the running but was weakening when falling two out in novice at Limerick (2m, heavy; 100-1) on hurdling debut; others appeal more.

runners.comment: 1m6f winner on Flat but has shown only modest form over hurdles; fair bit to prove
runners.name: Enziya
runners.spotlight: Signed off on the Flat in Ireland with 1m6f win last summer but showed only modest form on first two hurdling starts; was bumped and fell at first hurdle last time; fair bit to prove.

runners.comment: 2-14 on Flat; new yard has more than respectable strike-rate; interesting recruit
runners.name: Flash Man
runners.spotlight: 2-14 on the Flat in France, winning over 11.5f and 1m4f, including on soft ground; changed hands for 38,000euros in November; new stable has a more than respectable strike-rate; interesting recruit to hurdling.

runners.comment: 2yo winner for Aidan O'Brien; some promise in big field on hurdle debut; not ruled out
runners.name: Genealogy
runners.spotlight: Failed to progress on the Flat for Aidan O'Brien after a 1m 2yo win, but he shaped with some encouragement on hurdling debut when a never-nearer eighth in a big field at Leopardstown (80-1); should do better, and he looks the pick of the Hogan pair.

runners.comment: 20l sixth of ten at Cheltenham on British debut; needs to improve and that's possible
runners.name: Macshadow Des Crai
runners.spotlight: Made the frame in two French bumpers; similar form in two runs over hurdles, fading when 20l sixth of ten in juvenile at Cheltenham (2m1f, good to soft; 12-1) five weeks ago; finished around 14l behind Winston Junior that day but he's in good hands and should do better.

runners.comment: Not far off useful on the Flat, winning over 2m; commands respect on stable/hurdling debut
runners.name: Novelista
runners.spotlight: Not far off useful on the Flat for Charlie Johnston, proving reliable and winning 2m handicap at Goodwood (heavy) last autumn; changed hands for 165,000gns in October; likely to be suited by longer distances in due course but he commands respect on his hurdling debut even so.

runners.comment: Convincing winner on last of five Flat runs in France; likely type on British/hurdle debut
runners.name: Talakan
runners.spotlight: Didn't look fully exposed on the Flat in France, winning the last of his five races (14.5f, heavy) in convincing fashion, before being sold for 40,000euros; one of two likely types making their debuts for Toby Lawes.

runners.comment: Second at Fontwell and Cheltenham; could do with settling better but he's the pick on form
runners.name: Winston Junior
runners.spotlight: Useful maiden on the Flat in Ireland; has shaped nicely on both starts over hurdles, short of room before the last flight when second to a promising sort at Cheltenham (2m1f, good to soft; raced freely) five weeks ago; could do with settling better but has the best form as things stand.

runners.comment: Disappointing favourite in sole start this term; enough to prove back up in trip
runners.name: Outlaw Peter
runners.owner: The Stewart Family Dench Ferguson & Mason
runners.spotlight: Useful at 2m4f/2m5f on his day; rarely seen since the 2023-24 campaign, however, and was a disappointing favourite in sole start this term; enough to prove in this stiff scenario back over 3m.

runners.breeder: Yvon Madiot Herve Tison & Pauline Tison
runners.comment: Solid record (1213) since switched to fences; thereabouts provided he stays this new trip
runners.name: Issam
runners.spotlight: Overall strike-rate is 8-23; solid set of form figures (1213) since switch to fences, keeping on for creditable effort at Ascot (2m3f, good to soft) most recently; should be thereabouts provided he stays this new trip.

runners.comment: Lightly raced 8yo; won narrowly at Sandown most recently; may improve further over fences
runners.name: Welcom To Cartries
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 8yo who held on narrowly at Sandown (3m, good to soft; handicap chase debut) most recently, adding to his point/hurdle wins and posting a career-best performance; may be capable of further improvement in this sphere and commands respect.

runners.comment: Ran well at Sandown on debut for new stable; landed this race 12 months ago; big player
runners.name: In dOr
runners.spotlight: Bought for £220,000 at the David Maxwell dispersal prior to running well, only 2l behind Welcom To Cartries, at Sandown (3m, good to soft) on debut for new connections; this second-season chaser likely has further progress in him; sole attempt at Ascot resulted in a success in this race 12 months ago (good ground); big player back here.

runners.comment: This slight drop back in trip looks a plus; treated as still open to further improvement
runners.name: The Jukebox Kid
runners.spotlight: Overall record of 3-5 includes Carlisle success (2m5f) on chase debut; didn't quite get home over 3m1f when beaten favourite at Cheltenham (good to soft) since and this slight drop back in distance looks a plus; treated as still open to further improvement.

runners.comment: Has taken his form to a new level since upped to about 3m and switched to chasing
runners.name: Kap Vert
runners.spotlight: Has taken his form to a new level since upped in trip and switched to chasing, winning easily at Taunton (2m7f) then creditable third at Kempton (3m), both on good ground; still unexposed in this sphere and at this sort of distance; remains of interest.

runners.comment: Market may prove best guide on stable/seasonal debut; still with same owner
runners.name: Chavez
runners.spotlight: Bumper/hurdle scorer for Paul Nicholls and chase winner for Willie Mullins; beaten long way when last seen over a year ago, however; market may prove best guide on debut for Venetia Williams (still with same owner).

runners.breeder: R F And S D Knipe
runners.comment: Low-mileage 8yo; staying-on second upped to 3m at Bangor most recently; possibilities
runners.name: Laganhill
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 8yo who scored twice over hurdles last term; seemed to need reappearance effort behind The Jukebox Kid at Carlisle and duly fared better, staying-on second upped to 3m, at Bangor (heavy) later in November; interesting contender, with another step forward plausible.

runners.comment: Generally consistent but is considerably more exposed than many of these rivals
runners.name: Eyed
runners.spotlight: Form dipped last time but otherwise a consistent sort and may rebound; however, looks considerably more exposed than some of these rivals and possibly has nothing in hand off current mark.

runners.comment: Record of 2-3 since wearing visor features a C&D success on penultimate start
runners.name: Montregard
runners.spotlight: Record of 2-3 since wearing visor features a C&D success (good) on penultimate start; may still have more to offer in this headgear, provided he's back on song (ran as if something was possibly amiss last time).

runners.comment: Only a modest third last time when attempting to make it 3-3 in cheepkpieces
runners.name: Minella Blueway
runners.spotlight: Only a modest third at Chepstow (2m7f) last time when bidding to take his record in cheekpieces to 3-3; needs a bigger effort in the retained headgear, with some of these rivals stronger on recent form.

runners.comment: Below par this term, including over fences, but very dangerous on last season's form
runners.name: Joyeuse
runners.spotlight: Impressive winner of major handicap at Newbury (2m, soft) last February; beaten favourite over fences first two outings this season and a bit disappointing in warm C&D handicap back over hurdles last month, but it's far too soon to be writing her off and she'd be very dangerous on last season's form.

runners.comment: Made it 6-11 over hurdles at Sandown; drop back in trip a slight concern but respected
runners.name: Nurse Susan
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced and thriving, better than ever at the age of nine; took hurdles record to 6-11 when winning Listed event at Sandown (2m4f, good; handles soft) two weeks ago; today's drop back in trip is a slight concern (last four wins at 2m4f-2m7f) but she's on a roll and commands major respect for a stable with a fine record in this race.

runners.breeder: Franklin Finance & S Vidal & E Ribard
runners.comment: Smart in bumpers and has taken very well to hurdling; up in grade but may well be up to it
runners.name: La Conquiere
runners.spotlight: Fine second in Grade 2 bumper at last season's Grand National meeting and has made a seamless transition to hurdling, winning at Uttoxeter (2m, good) and Newbury (2m, soft); up in grade and taking on vastly more experienced rivals today, but she has plenty of class and may well be up to it.

runners.comment: Hard to fancy on recent form but was third in this race last year and could bounce back
runners.name: Ooh Betty
runners.spotlight: Can make the running and she's versatile trip-wise; hard to fancy on this season's form (beat just one home at Taunton in December) but it was only last spring that she finished a close third in the Scottish Champion Hurdle at Ayr (2m, good to soft); needs to be back near her best but she was a creditable third in this race last year and it's possible.

runners.comment: Closely matched with Nurse Susan on recent Sandown running; unlikely to be far away
runners.name: Sunset Marquesa
runners.spotlight: Keeps getting better and she followed a clearcut handicap win at Sandown (2m4f, soft) with a good fourth to Nurse Susan in a Listed event over the same C&D two weeks ago; 4lb better off with that rival today and there's unlikely to be much between them.

runners.breeder: Mme C Villaud Ameline & Mr Q Villaud
runners.comment: Ended long losing run in the Old Roan but well held last time and needs to bounce back
runners.name: Hitman
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in this race last year and he ended a long losing sequence in the Old Roan at Aintree (2m4f, good to soft) on reappearance; however, he's less consistent than he once was and he was well held in the Peterborough Chase at Huntingdon last time; needs to bounce back from that.

runners.comment: Tailed off on stable debut; needs to have come on a ton in the 16 days since
runners.name: Jungle Boogie
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 12yo; had a record of 3-3 for Willie Mullins and 2-5 for Henry de Bromhead, but he was tailed off on stable debut at Cheltenham (22-1) on New Year's Day and needs to have come on a ton in the 16 days since.

runners.comment: Far from reliable but made all over 2m3f here last month; chance if in the same mood
runners.name: Etalon
runners.spotlight: Far from reliable but he's a classy chaser on his day, as he showed when making all under a dynamic ride over 2m3f here just before Christmas; the cheekpieces need to work for a second time and he's unproven over this longer distance, but he still can't be ruled out if on another going day.

runners.comment: Not at best behind Etalon here latest but still young and could turn the tables this time
runners.name: Bad
runners.spotlight: Wasn't going from some way out when favourite behind Etalon here last time but he'd previously won comfortably at Kempton (2m2f, good) and run creditably in the Paddy Power Gold Cup at Cheltenham (2m4f, soft) where the hill proved too much; still relatively young; 5lb better off with Etalon and could turn the tables.

runners.comment: Well below par of late and needs to be revived by recent wind surgery
runners.name: Fugitif
runners.spotlight: Does most of his racing these days at Cheltenham but well below par there of late, including when fifth of eight in a veterans' race in December; perhaps wind surgery (not his first) will spark a revival but he's probably best watched all the same.

runners.comment: Reliable; runner-up in competitive events on last three starts and high on the list again
runners.name: Vincenzo
runners.spotlight: Reliable sort, runner-up in competitive events on last three starts; followed fine effort behind a thriving Panic Attack in the Paddy Power at Cheltenham (2m4f, soft) with another good run there five weeks ago when a mistake at the last didn't help; has notably solid form and high on the list again.

runners.comment: Likes Ascot and ran right up to best when chasing home Etalon last time; in the mix again
runners.name: Scarface
runners.spotlight: Likes Ascot and performed right up to his best when chasing home Etalon here (2m3f, good to soft; fine on heavy) four weeks ago; just as effective over this sort of trip and now has his usual headgear back on after one go in blinkers; should be in the thick of things again.

runners.comment: Back to last winning mark and probably retains his ability; interesting under 7lb claimer
runners.name: Heltenham
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late N W Lake
runners.spotlight: Now back to last winning mark and it looks as if he retains all his ability, coming from well back when second at Newbury on return and only a few lengths down when falling two out at Aintree on Boxing Day; versatile ground-wise and this sort of trip is ideal; interesting under 7lb claimer.

runners.comment: C&D win came in uncompetitive race and he was only fourth of six next time
runners.name: Neon Moon
runners.spotlight: Led late on over C&D (good ground; handles softer) in November but that was an uncompetitive race and he was only fourth of six at Ludlow next time; still 3lb higher than for the win and others appeal more.

runners.comment: Stiff task back over hurdles last time; lightly raced and not ruled out on handicap debut
runners.name: Tripoli Flyer
runners.spotlight: Didn't take to fences, but he ran creditably in the face of a stiff task back over hurdles when fifth of six in Grade 1 event at Kempton (2m, good; wore cheekpieces) on Boxing Day; not fully proven over this trip but he's still relatively lightly raced and hard to rule out on handicap debut.

runners.breeder: E A R L Trinquet & M & O Trinquet
runners.comment: Veteran; third in the Greatwood at Cheltenham and not disgraced last time; should go well
runners.name: Faivoir
runners.spotlight: Grand veteran who retains plenty of ability and was third in the Greatwood at Cheltenham (2m, soft) in November; not disgraced in another warm race here (28-1) four weeks ago and this is less competitive; should go well with Harry Skelton returning to the saddle for the first time since a narrow defeat in the Imperial Cup in March 2024.

runners.comment: Well handicapped on old form but needs first-time cheekpieces to have a positive effect
runners.name: Metier
runners.spotlight: Has been a money-spinner for connections over the years but recent efforts (Flat and jumps) have been subdued and he faded into a well-held fourth at Sandown (28-1) in December; well handicapped on old form but needs first-time cheekpieces to have a positive effect.

runners.comment: Back to same mark as convincing 2025 course win but hasn't finished in first six this term
runners.name: Samuel Spade
runners.spotlight: Back to the same mark as for last season's convincing course win (2m7f, good) but hasn't finished in the first six this term, always behind over 2m5f here last time; takes another drop in distance and wears headgear for the first time.

runners.comment: Low-mileage 7yo; had fair bit in hand at Hereford; up 7lb but open to further improvement
runners.name: Came From Nowhere
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 7yo whose record reads 133321; had fair bit in hand with tongue-tie applied at Hereford (2m3f, soft) in December; up 7lb but open to further improvement and high on the list.

runners.comment: Won in big field at Punchestown last spring; below par twice since but blinkers now go on
runners.name: Thanksforthehelp
runners.spotlight: Won 25-runner handicap at the Punchestown festival (2m3f, yielding) last spring and remains well handicapped on older form, but he's hard to predict and has been some way below par in two runs this season; however, blinkers replace cheekpieces today and market support would be significant.

runners.comment: Arrives after two seconds over 2m; should be involved again if staying this longer trip
runners.name: Marche dAligre
runners.owner: Billam Roe Swindell Wilson & The Molds
runners.spotlight: Arrives in good form after seconds at Wetherby and Sandown (both 2m, soft), no extra after a mistake at the last on second occasion; now moves up in distance, and if he stays he should be involved again.

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras De Montaigu
runners.comment: In good form last spring but woeful in three runs this season; difficult to recommend
runners.name: Patriotik
runners.spotlight: In good form last spring but woeful in three runs this season, beaten at least 34l each time; perhaps cheekpieces will rekindle his enthusiasm but he's difficult to recommend unless strong in the market.

runners.comment: Three wins this season, latest when upped to 2m5f; may not have reached his limit just yet
runners.name: Surrey Lord
runners.spotlight: Having an excellent season, winning at Ffos Las and Kempton (both 2m) in the autumn and finding further improvement when upped to 2m5f back at Kempton on Boxing Day; raised another 6lb for latest win but he may not have reached his limit just yet.

runners.comment: Likes Ascot; beaten long way by Came From Nowhere at Hereford latest; needs to bounce back
runners.name: Moveit Like Minnie
runners.owner: F J Mills & W R Mills
runners.spotlight: Third in this race last year off 2lb higher and twice ran creditably over 2m here in November, but he's fully exposed and he was beaten a long way by Came From Nowhere at Hereford in December; needs to bounce back.

runners.comment: Good second to top-class Jango Baie on return; more needed today but should still go well
runners.name: Gidleigh Park
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 8yo who won Grade 2s as a novice hurdler and novice chaser; ran as well as he's ever done when 9l second to top-class Jango Baie in Grade 2 chase here (2m5f, good; handles soft) in November; more needed today but the drop back in trip should not inconvenience him in the slightest.

runners.breeder: E Clayeux & S C Ecurie Couderc
runners.comment: 7-9 over fences and slammed Jonbon by 9l in the Tingle Creek; has excellent credentials
runners.name: Il Etait Temps
runners.spotlight: Hugely likeable chaser who made it 7-9 over fences when slamming Jonbon by 9l in the Grade 1 Tingle Creek at Sandown (1m7f, good to soft; fine on softer) six weeks ago; that represented another personal best and he's the clear pick on the ratings; has excellent credentials.

runners.comment: Formerly dominant in this division but twice readily outpointed by Il Etait Temps in 2025
runners.name: Jonbon
runners.spotlight: Formerly dominant in this division, but starting to look vulnerable and was readily outpointed by Il Etait Temps in the Celebration Chase in April and Tingle Creek (wore cheekpieces) in December, both at Sandown; landed the odds in this race 12 months ago but his air of invincibility has since evaporated; partnered for the first time by Harry Cobden.

runners.comment: 4-4 on good ground for new yard; hard to discount but will need another personal best
runners.name: Thistle Ask
runners.spotlight: One of the success stories of the season, improving dramatically for new yard and rattling off four handicap wins (2m-2m3f, all on good); showed high-class form when routing six rivals at Kempton just after Christmas; impossible to discount, but he'll need another personal best in this higher grade and he also has to prove he's as effective on ground softer than good.

16:05.race_name: BetMGM EBF "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)

runners.breeder: E A R L Ecurie Des Mottes
runners.comment: Kempton winner in November; further progress when close fifth at Cheltenham; in the mix
runners.name: Kasino Des Mottes
runners.spotlight: Bought for £130,000 after Irish point win last March, and he got up late on over hurdles at Kempton (2m5f, good) in November; made further progress when a close fifth in Grade 2 novice at Cheltenham (3m, good to soft) five weeks ago; going the right way and should be thereabouts again.

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras DEnki
runners.comment: Promise all three starts; Hereford win is already working out well; big chance
runners.name: Laguna Beach
runners.owner: M Buckley C Noell And M Hankin
runners.spotlight: Has shown promise all three starts; was third to a useful rival at Sandown on hurdling debut, and his Hereford win (2m3f, good to soft) last month is already working out well; should be suited by the further step up in distance; yard won this race in 2019 and 2020 (no runners since); big chance.

runners.comment: Easy winner on hurdles debut and defeat next time came in stronger race; retains potential
runners.name: Minella Marathon
runners.spotlight: £200,000 purchase after justifying favouritism in an Irish point; easy winner on hurdling debut at Lingfield (2m3f, good to soft) in November, and a comprehensive defeat at Cheltenham the following month came in a much stronger race; now has to bounce back in a first-time tongue-strap but he certainly retains potential.

runners.comment: Hugely impressive winner on hurdles debut; meets stronger opposition but could be anything
runners.name: The Burren Man
runners.spotlight: Shaped well in a point last April, after which he was sold for 180,000euros; heavily backed and made a hugely impressive hurdling debut at Carlisle (2m3f, soft) in November, making smooth headway and readily pulling clear of 11 rivals; meets stronger opposition here but could be anything.

runners.comment: No promise when pulled up on hurdling debut at Ffos Las; hard to fancy
runners.name: Betgoodwin
runners.spotlight: No promise when pulled up on hurdling debut at Ffos Las (stablemate Mymilkman was also well held); hard to fancy.

runners.comment: Runner-up in two points early in 2025 but no real encouragement so far under rules
runners.name: Mymilkman
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in two points early in 2025 but no real encouragement so far under rules; unlikely to be of much interest until tackling handicaps.

runners.comment: Strong at finish when winning Irish point in October and commands respect on hurdles debut
runners.name: Tobyshill
runners.spotlight: Finished strongly when winning Irish point in October and the third has won two similar events since; changed hands for £85,000 in November; commands respect on hurdles debut, especially if the market speaks in his favour.

runners.comment: Proving consistent and beaten off only on run-in at Doncaster last time; not ruled out
runners.name: Uptown Dandy
runners.spotlight: More experienced than most of these and he keeps giving his running, beaten off only on the run-in when second of four in novice at Doncaster (2m3f, good to soft) five weeks ago; should be winning before long and he's not ruled out here.

runners.comment: Promising second in bumper last spring and he's related to lots of winners over jumps
runners.name: Whiskey Yankee
runners.spotlight: Brother to the same connections' useful 2m3f/3m hurdle winner Ed Keeper and made a promising start when second of five in Ffos Las bumper (good ground; 5-2) last spring; related to lots of winners over jumps and he's respected on hurdling debut after ten months off; fitted with a tongue-strap.

12:15.race_name: Sky Bet Extra Places Handicap Chase (Go North Monet's Garden Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Consistent 9yo who is handicapped to be in the shake-up if cutting out the mistakes
runners.name: Cerendipity
runners.spotlight: Fell at Wetherby on Boxing Day and his jumping lacked fluency when fourth of six there (2m3f, soft) in November; however, this consistent 9yo is handicapped to be in the shake-up if cutting out the mistakes.

runners.comment: 2-2 in handicaps and this very lightly raced 7yo could be even better now up in trip
runners.name: Throatlash
runners.spotlight: 3m point winner who made winning handicap debut at Wetherby (1m7f, soft) in November on second chase start and followed up at Aintree (2m, good to soft); this very lightly raced 7yo could be even better now up in trip.

runners.comment: Running pretty well in warm novice handicap chases and this should take less winning
runners.name: Southoftheborder
runners.spotlight: Yet to seriously threaten over fences but he's run pretty well in warm novice handicap chases on his last three starts and today's contest should take less winning; possible player following a 2lb drop.

runners.comment: On a dangerous mark but underwhelming since winning on last season's reappearance
runners.name: Choose A Copper
runners.spotlight: Down to a dangerous mark and could get back on track at some point but he's been underwhelming since winning on last season's reappearance (2m4f, soft), finishing down the field at Newcastle last month after a break.

runners.comment: Absent since December 2024 but given chance by handicapper and his stable is going well
runners.name: Imperial Bede
runners.spotlight: 0-9 over fences since winning on his chase debut in February 2024 and absent since that December; however, he's been given a big chance by the handicapper and returns with his stable going well; watch the betting.

runners.comment: Two chase wins in 2024 and returned from long absence with encouraging fifth last month
runners.name: Icare Grandchamp
runners.spotlight: 2-6 over fences, the wins coming in 2024 (2m5f/2m4f, good); following a long absence he returned with an encouraging fifth at Newbury (2m4f, good to soft) and could show the benefit of that outing today.

runners.breeder: Mrs Mossie Hayes & Mr Tom Hayes
runners.comment: Runner-up at Catterick on both chase starts and could be bang there once more
runners.name: Bridge Court
runners.spotlight: Point runner-up who improved for the switch to fences when second at Catterick (2m3f, good to soft) last month and got even closer to a first win when beaten a nose there (2m3f, good) 12 days later; could be bang there.

runners.comment: Reappeared with solid second at Ayr in November; unseated at Newcastle on Thursday
runners.name: Tommy Combats
runners.spotlight: Took well to fences last season, winning at Hexham (1m7f, soft), and reappeared with solid second at Ayr (2m4f, soft) in November; in front rank when unseating in back straight at Newcastle on Thursday; not ruled out.

runners.comment: Runner-up at Ffos Las then unsuited by going right-handed at Leicester most recently
runners.name: Dj Pete
runners.spotlight: 8yo who made it 0-12 when soundly beaten at Leicester three weeks ago but he jumped to the left at that right-handed track; runner-up to thriving winner at Ffos Las (2m3f, soft) two starts ago and he could have a part to play now going back left-handed; effective on good and soft ground.

12:50.race_name: Sky Bet Club Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: Below par this season but has had wind op; won the Scottish Champion Hurdle off this mark
runners.name: Cracking Rhapsody
runners.owner: J D Wright & Mrs S Wright
runners.spotlight: Below par on both runs this season but has had wind surgery since and he's back down to the same mark as for his win in the Scottish Champion Hurdle at Ayr (2m, good to soft); not ruled out on this drop in grade.

runners.comment: Has regressed but was third over C&D last time off reduced mark; might not be far away
runners.name: Brentford Hope
runners.spotlight: 9yo who has regressed but is down the weights and has run pretty well on his last two starts, finishing sixth of 11 at Cheltenham (2m1f, good to soft) then 5l third of eight here (1m7f, good); might not be far away.

runners.comment: Returns from absence but likes it here and won this race 12 months ago
runners.name: Berties Ballet
runners.spotlight: Won this last year (soft) before good second at Wetherby (2m3f, soft) in February off this 5lb higher mark; absent since but likes it here and not ruled out on return to action; has shown promise on good to soft.

runners.comment: Kelso novice winner who is in good hands to progress and brings potential to h'cap debut
runners.name: Caballo De Guerra
runners.owner: A H B Hodge & Mrs H Cheape
runners.spotlight: Won in good style on hurdle debut at Kelso (2m, good) in October and fourth in a couple of warm races subsequently (2m, good/soft); in good hands to progress and he brings potential to this handicap debut.

runners.comment: Promising second on last hurdle start and held back by his jumping over fences since
runners.name: Captain Butler
runners.spotlight: Point, bumper (2m1f, good) and maiden hurdle (2m, good to soft) winner who was a promising second on handicap/stable debut at Ayr (2m4f, soft) in November; held back by his jumping on his first two chase starts and could have a big part to play now back over hurdles.

runners.breeder: G Durrheim And Maria Mulcahy Durrheim
runners.comment: Travelled well before fading over 2m3f here and could benefit from the drop back in trip
runners.name: A Different Kind
runners.spotlight: He's returned from a long absence this season and hasn't been able to recapture his considerable 2023 promise; however, he travelled well before weakening over 2m3f here four weeks ago on his second start back and could benefit from today's drop back in trip; not discounted.

runners.comment: Made it 5-7 over hurdles when winning on handicap debut; could have more left in the tank
runners.name: Smart Decision
runners.spotlight: Made it 5-7 in his career (all over hurdles) when winning by 1l under William Easterby on handicap debut at Market Rasen (2m2f, good to soft) on Boxing Day; needs another step forward to defy a 5lb rise in this better race but this 5yo may well have more left in the tank.

runners.comment: 0-8 under rules in Ireland but has joined top trainer for British career; watch the market
runners.name: Coumeenoole
runners.spotlight: Point winner who made it 0-8 under rules for Paul Nolan in Ireland when well beaten over fences in November, and he's unraced at a trip shorter than 2m4f; however, he showed promise in maiden hurdles and has joined a top trainer for his British career; interesting to see how he goes in the market.

13:25.race_name: Sky Bet Supreme Trial Rossington Main Novices' Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Impressive Listed win at Sandown and it remains to be seen where his limitations lie
runners.name: Hurricane Pat
runners.spotlight: 2-3 in bumpers and 2-2 over hurdles following a pair of wins at Sandown (2m, good to soft/soft), the latest a Listed novice last time; he was impressive last time (Soldier Reeves about 6l back in second) and it remains to be seen where his limitations lie; key player.

runners.comment: Made it 2-2 over hurdles with 12l win at Cheltenham and he holds leading claims
runners.name: Old Park Star
runners.spotlight: Placed in his three bumpers for Paul Nicholls (one on soft) and made it 2-2 over hurdles for Nicky Henderson when winning by 12l at Cheltenham (2m1f, good to soft) last month; leading claims for top trainer who has won three of the last six runnings.

runners.comment: Enjoys weights turnaround with Hurricane Pat from Sandown but was no match for that rival
runners.name: Soldier Reeves
runners.spotlight: Built upon point/bumper promise (including on good to soft ground) to win on hurdle debut at Cheltenham (2m, soft) in November; another good run when Listed runner-up at Sandown (2m, soft) since and he's 5lb better off with the winner Hurricane Pat, although that rival had plenty in hand.

runners.comment: 2-2 over hurdles but this is tougher and others have more substance to their form
runners.name: Japetus
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on debut in bumper last February (2m, soft) and 4-4 since (good to soft/good), winning at Market Rasen (2m) this season on his first two hurdle starts; he's a highly likeable prospect but today is a much tougher test of his credentials and others have more substance to their form.

runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khans Studs S C
runners.comment: Smart stayer on Flat in his prime; encouraging start to jumps career but looks vulnerable
runners.name: Tashkhan
runners.spotlight: Smart stayer on the Flat in his prime and he won on hurdle debut at Hexham (2m4f, heavy) last month; another good run when third at Kelso (2m6f, good to soft) since but likely his limitations will be exposed once more today.

runners.comment: Useful, four-time Flat winner; promise on hurdle debut but considerable improvement needed
runners.name: Wahraan
runners.spotlight: Useful, four-time Flat winner who showed promise when third on hurdle debut at Wetherby (2m, soft) last month, albeit proving an awkward ride; has had wind surgery since; considerable improvement is necessary in this company.

14:00.race_name: Sky Bet Peter Marsh Handicap Chase (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Five-time course winner including this in 2021 and 2022; Grade 1 runner-up here last time
runners.name: Royale Pagaille
runners.spotlight: Five-time course winner including this race in 2021 and 2022 and the Betfair Chase in 2023 and 2024; reappeared with fine second in that Grade 1 here 56 days ago (good to soft); struggled last season after his reappearance win but this 12yo could have a big say if backing up his latest effort.

runners.comment: Went close in the Kim Muir last March and big run at Ascot last month; could be bang there
runners.name: Johnnywho
runners.spotlight: Beaten just a neck in the Kim Muir at the Cheltenham Festival (3m2f, good to soft) last March and finished strongly for close third in the Silver Cup at Ascot (3m, good to soft) last month; every chance he'll be bang there.

runners.comment: 3-3 this season when completing; tougher task today but he's clearly thriving
runners.name: Konfusion
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who is 3-3 this season when completing, posting easy wins on last two starts at Newcastle (2m7f, good to soft) and Wetherby (3m, soft); had just three rivals to beat last time and now 9lb higher in a tougher race, but he's clearly thriving and his stable has won this race five times.

runners.breeder: S A R L Genetique Obstacle
runners.comment: Bolted up in 2023 Welsh National off this mark; pulled/tailed off on his six starts since
runners.name: Nassalam
runners.spotlight: Bolted up in the Welsh National in December 2023 (3m6f, heavy) and runs off the same mark today; however, he's been pulled up/tailed off on all six starts since; wind surgery needs to prompt a dramatic revival.

runners.comment: Prone to the odd major blunder but seriously impressive at Cheltenham Festival last March
runners.name: Myretown
runners.spotlight: Prone to the odd major blunder, as when falling mid-race in the Coral Gold Cup at Newbury in November, when favourite; however, he was seriously impressive when making all by 11l in the Ultima at the Cheltenham Festival (3m1f, good to soft) last March, and this 15lb higher mark may not stop him.

runners.comment: A case can be made on last season's best form but not at the same level so far this term
runners.name: Imperial Saint
runners.spotlight: Three wins at Aintree (2m/2m4f, good/good to soft) last season and second there (3m1f, good) in April; current mark shouldn't be beyond him if he's at his best but that hasn't been the case on his two outings this term.

runners.comment: Third in this last year and this 10yo is now 8lb lower; could be involved
runners.name: Richmond Lake
runners.spotlight: Ran really well when third in this last year (soft) and kept on for second at Aintree (2m4f, soft) last month, albeit no match for the winner; this 10yo has a good record here and, now 8lb lower than 12 months ago, he could be involved back up in trip.

14:35.race_name: Sky Bet Acca Freeze Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Stayers Hurdle Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: His mark continues to tumble but for good reason and a major revival is required
runners.name: Stay Away Fay
runners.spotlight: Won a Grade 1 novice hurdle and Grade 2 novice chase in 2023; his mark continues to tumble but for good reason and a major revival is required with first-time blinkers replacing cheekpieces.

runners.comment: Ran mighty race over C&D on reappearance; chase debut fall next time; capable of bold bid
runners.name: Phantomofthepoints
runners.owner: Mrs Jo Tracey K Alexander P&S Bryceland
runners.spotlight: Ran a mighty race from the front when third of 17 in hot handicap hurdle over C&D (good to soft) on reappearance; fell on chase debut next time and he's capable of a very bold bid now back hurdling.

runners.comment: 10yo who has run pretty well in defeat on both runs this term and might not be far away
runners.name: Kyntara
runners.spotlight: Highly progressive staying hurdler in 2023-24 campaign and chasing didn't work out for him last season; this 10yo has run pretty well in defeat over hurdles on both runs this term (3m, good to soft) and might not be far away.

runners.comment: Won at Kelso 19 days ago and this progressive 8yo has a chance for his in-form yard
runners.name: Both Barrels
runners.spotlight: His form can be in and out but he's been progressive among the blips and was back on song when winning at Kelso (extended 2m6f, good to soft) 19 days ago; this trip may be within range and has a chance for in-form yard.

runners.comment: Could be suited by the return to hurdling but her profile is patchy
runners.name: Pinot Rouge
runners.spotlight: Made mistakes when pulled up over fences at Newcastle last time and she could be suited by the return to hurdling; won in this sphere at Hexham (2m7f, good to soft) last June but her profile is patchy and her claims aren't overly compelling.

runners.comment: Inconsistent but produced a positive performance on Boxing Day and could be involved
runners.name: Icare Allen
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent but he won at Uttoxeter (2m4f, good) last July and returned from a break with a close third at Wetherby (2m5f, soft) on Boxing Day, staying on nicely; he'll be fine now back up in trip and could be involved.

runners.comment: Bred to be suited by this step up in trip on handicap debut; could have lots more to offer
runners.name: Dalston Lad
runners.owner: Cherry Knoll Farm M Ward & D Skelton
runners.spotlight: 3m point and two-time bumper winner who has improved with each of his three hurdle starts, winning easily at 4-9 at Sedgefield (2m4f, good to soft) last time in first-time cheekpieces (retained); bred to be suited by this step up in trip on handicap debut (half-brother to leading Peter Marsh contender Myretown, among others) and could have lots more to offer for top yard.

runners.comment: Won on this card 12 months ago; returns from absence but could have potential at this trip
runners.name: Solar System
runners.spotlight: Made it two wins in a row (2m5f, good to soft/soft) when scoring on this card 12 months ago; had an excuse last March when last seen (made a mistake three out); could have untapped potential at this trip; interesting.

runners.comment: 4 wins last year and close 3rd last time; in a better race here but could improve further
runners.name: Heather Honey
runners.spotlight: Won three in a row last April-June (2m7f, good) and resumed her progressive ways with convincing win at Catterick (3m1f, good) in November; another good run when close third at Doncaster (3m, good to soft); needs something extra in this better race but further improvement isn't ruled out.

runners.comment: Continues to drop down weights but regressive profile and needs to raise his game
runners.name: Inis Oirr
runners.spotlight: Showed spark when going close over fences in October and didn't run badly when fifth of seven here last time back over hurdles; continues to drop down the weights but he has a regressive profile and needs to raise his game.

15:10.race_name: Sky Bet Build A Bet Handicap Hurdle (Go North Cab On Target Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: Well treated on best form but needs to prove he retains that ability
runners.name: Hillview
runners.spotlight: Modest effort in small field on return from lengthy absence last time, albeit seeming to need the run; remains well treated on best form but needs to prove he retains that ability.

runners.comment: Took a step backwards last time but still has low mileage and can't be written off
runners.name: Akimos
runners.spotlight: Henderson hurdler who has low mileage; successful in maiden event last spring and good second in Sandown handicap (again over 2m4f) on reappearance; lesser effort at Leicester since but can't be written off.

runners.comment: Looks a strong contender back over hurdles with Freddie Keighley taking off 7lb
runners.name: Below The Radar
runners.spotlight: Mid-race faller switched to chasing most recently; has frame possibilities judged on last three hurdles efforts (423) and Freddie Keighley's useful 7lb claim may improve the chance of getting back on the scoresheet.

runners.breeder: Haras De Saint Voir Sca & Mr Joel Denis
runners.comment: Improved form this term; collared only in the final strides over 2m3f here last time
runners.name: Knomorediamonds
runners.spotlight: Has shown improvement this term and was collared only in the final strides at Haydock (2m3f, good to soft) most recently, having been mostly clear from four out; likely player provided he stays this new trip.

runners.comment: Not solid on her form for new stable
runners.name: Ring O Roses
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish mare who isn't solid on her form for new stable; failed to beat a rival last time; best watched unless the market suggests otherwise.

runners.comment: Consistent at Kelso since last April but this looks a tougher assignment
runners.name: Magic Wave
runners.spotlight: Campaigned at Kelso (2m5f/2m6f) since last April, posting form figures of 132; edging back up the weights and now goes into a much bigger field switched back to elsewhere; not certain to remain competitive.

runners.comment: Sole attempt over C&D resulted in maiden win last March; interesting back here
runners.name: High Dancer
runners.spotlight: Favourite in both starts this season for new yard, better effort when keeping-on second at Doncaster (2m3f, soft) latest; may well take another step forward, as sole attempt over C&D (good) resulted in maiden win last March; interesting back here.

runners.comment: Couple of solid performances under rules; further improvement is plausible
runners.name: Judicial Deference
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at sixth attempt in Irish points; solid performances in two maiden hurdles for new stable, making all at Musselburgh (2m4f, good to soft) latest; respected on handicap debut, with further improvement plausible.

runners.comment: Completed hat-trick last spring; not in anything like the same form since
runners.name: Kilmore Rock
runners.spotlight: Took well to cheekpieces by completing a hat-trick last spring; not in anything like the same form, over hurdles and fences, in the retained headgear since.

runners.comment: Chase winner in Ireland; market support should be heeded on debut for Dan Skelton
runners.name: Jasmin De Cotte
runners.spotlight: Campaigned mostly over fences in Ireland for Paul Nolan, winning once; had wind surgery since last run; something to prove back over hurdles but market support should be heeded on debut for Dan Skelton.

runners.comment: Record of 212 in last three hurdles attempts; solid chance in current form
runners.name: Wasthatok
runners.spotlight: Record of 212 in last three hurdles attempts, the win at Newcastle (2m4f) when ending a long losing spell; good second at Catterick (2m3f) most recently; solid chance in current form.

runners.comment: Form dipped last spring and absent since
runners.name: Broderick
runners.spotlight: Had a solid spell at maiden/novice level last winter but form dipped in the spring and absent since; still needs to prove he stays this distance; others preferred.

runners.comment: Benefited from the switch to handicap level last time (1m7f) and may build on that win
runners.name: Killycarn
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 6yo who benefited from the switch to handicap level at Catterick (1m7f, good) most recently, opening his account; may well build on that success and improve further; promising contender, assuming he stays this longer distance.

runners.comment: Had wind surgery since last run; debut for new yard; market helpful
runners.name: Victoria Milano
runners.spotlight: Scored twice at novice level but failed to progress in handicaps for Alastair Ralph; sold for £10,000 and had wind surgery since last appearance; tongue-tie added; market may give further guidance.

runners.comment: Consistent this season until folding tamely last time; 0-6 in handicaps
runners.name: Roaring Home
runners.spotlight: Consistent this season until folding tamely when favourite last time; had wind surgery (her second) since and may rebound but faces a stiffer task in this competitive field; 0-6 in handicaps.

runners.comment: Ran well on handicap debut last time and helps to give his stable a promising hand
runners.name: Fast Work
runners.spotlight: Seven-race maiden; ran well behind Brookside La at Wetherby (2m3f) on handicap debut most recently and may build on that effort; along with Killycarn, helps to give his stable a reasonably promising hand.

runners.comment: Made a winning handicap debut last time; this Skelton runner should progress further
runners.name: Brookside La
runners.spotlight: Made a winning handicap debut in Wetherby contest (2m3f, soft) last time, opening his account; this Skelton runner looks the type to show further progress; big player at the foot of the weights upped further in trip.

15:45.race_name: Sky Bet, For The Fans Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: C&D winner but race-fitness is a query and his best form has come on soft/heavy ground
runners.name: Classic Maestro
runners.spotlight: Four wins last season including two over fences (one C&D); not necessarily handicapped out of things but race-fitness is a query (early unseat on sole run this season) and his best form has come on soft and heavy ground, which isn't forecast to prevail today.

runners.comment: Nicely clear with the runner-up when winning over C&D last month; respected up 5lb
runners.name: Escapeandevade
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on first two starts for this yard (2m, good/good to soft) before winning over C&D (soft) four weeks ago; this 10yo is 5lb higher than last time but came nicely clear with the runner-up; respected.

runners.comment: Rare run over fences; tailed off over hurdles last time but won in that sphere in November
runners.name: Hardy Du Seuil
runners.spotlight: This is his first chase start since March 2024 and he was tailed off over hurdles at Ascot four weeks ago; however, he won at Windsor (2m, good to soft) two starts ago and is well treated on his old chase form (including here); not discounted.

runners.comment: Promising chase debut, then jumping held him back; first run for Dan Skelton; watch market
runners.name: Palamon
runners.spotlight: Flat/hurdle winner who was runner-up for Paul Nolan on chase debut at Wexford (2m3f, good) last July; his jumping held him back on his two starts since but he's joined a top British yard and makes his stable debut following wind surgery; interesting, especially if well backed.

runners.comment: Four chase wins last term but plenty to prove on this season's evidence
runners.name: Stormin Crossgales
runners.spotlight: Four chase wins last season and well handicapped on his best form; however, pulled up on first two runs this term and 200-1 when unseating early at Ludlow last month; plenty to prove.

runners.comment: 12yo who is racing for first time since last February, but won back then and not ruled out
runners.name: Mr Grey Sky
runners.spotlight: 12yo who is racing for the first time since last February; however, he won at Leicester (2m, heavy) back then and he won after some time off in November 2023 (2m, good to soft); 2-2 here (bumpers in 2018); not discounted.

runners.comment: Impressive on chase debut on New Year's Day and could take an 8lb rise in his stride
runners.name: Koukeo
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 6yo who took a big step forward with 10l win on his chase and seasonal debut at Windsor (2m, good) on New Year's Day; has shown promise on soft/good to soft; had just three rivals to beat last time but he's very unexposed over fences and could take an 8lb rise in his stride.

runners.comment: 2-2 over fences and could still be well treated for his top yard
runners.name: Kykorock
runners.spotlight: Point winner who left his bumper/novice hurdle form behind to score on handicap/chase debut at Warwick (2m, soft) in November, and followed up at Market Rasen (2m1f, good to soft) on Boxing Day; did it cosily last time and he could still be well treated for his top yard now 7lb higher.

runners.breeder: Philippe Ouvry & Ecurie Des Vives Terres
runners.comment: Encouraging third at Bangor following a break but this 12yo is winless since March 2023
runners.name: Grey Diamond
runners.spotlight: C&D winner whose mark continues to fall and he was an encouraging third at Bangor in November following a break; however, this inconsistent 12yo is winless since March 2023 and others arrive with more pressing claims.

runners.comment: Has done well since being switched to fences but career-best needed now back up in grade
runners.name: Willie Shake Hands
runners.spotlight: Won on chase debut at Hexham (1m7f, good) last May and some good runs since, most recently close third of six at Doncaster (2m, good to soft) after a break; however, a career-best is needed now back up in grade.

runners.comment: His best effort on AW debut latest when third of 12 at Wolverhampton last month.
runners.name: Double Combo
runners.spotlight: Placed on last two starts, his best effort on AW debut latest when third of 12 at Wolverhampton (8.5f) last month; steps up in trip and open to improvement now he goes handicapping.

runners.comment: Ran a bit better when fifth on AW debut at Wolverhampton last month.
runners.name: Morbeh
runners.spotlight: Nicely bred and represents major connections but finished down the field in two turf events; returned from a short break and ran a bit better when fifth of 12 on AW debut at Wolverhampton (8.5f) last month in first-time blinkers (left off here); steps up in trip on handicap debut and needs to show more.

runners.comment: Showed marked improvement on third start when third of eight here last month.
runners.name: Lord Mayor
runners.spotlight: Showed marked improvement on third start when third of eight here (1m) last month; bred for middle distances, he should come into his own now that he steps up in trip on his handicap debut and Oisin Murphy rides for the first time.

runners.comment: Won at Wolverhampton last month and not beaten far in two similar contests there since.
runners.name: Snaafy
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark at Wolverhampton (8.5f) last month and not beaten far in two similar contests there since; steps up in trip and still on the upgrade; should run well.

runners.comment: Got off the mark when stepping up to 1m2f at Chelmsford in November; placed twice since.
runners.name: Onyeisi
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark when stepping up to 1m2f in first-time blinkers (retained since) at Chelmsford in November; placed twice since and should not be far away.

runners.comment: Below par five days ago but normally consistent; thereabouts if bouncing back
runners.name: Zooks
runners.spotlight: Successful twice and made the frame numerous times in a very consistent 2025 campaign; began 2026 with a below-par effort five days ago but should be thereabouts if normal service is resumed.

runners.comment: Ran encouragingly in first-time visor over C&D most recently; possibilities
runners.name: The Craftymaster
runners.owner: R Miles V Miles T Stamp & Partner
runners.spotlight: On a long losing sequence but ran encouragingly in first-time visor over C&D most recently and has possibilities provided he builds on that effort; the last of his seven AW wins came off 18lb higher.

runners.comment: Has failed to back up the form of her 1m5f win; first crack at 2m on Flat
runners.name: Arenas Del Tiempo
runners.owner: D Edmonston T Helliwell & S J Holden
runners.spotlight: Ended a long losing spell with 1m5f success in August but has failed to back up the form in two starts over same trip this winter; this new scenario (first crack at 2m on Flat) needs to help.

runners.comment: Four-race maiden who has weak form claims; upped further in trip
runners.name: Marine
runners.spotlight: Four-race maiden who is far from solid on his form since returning from mammoth absence; never figured in 1m4f handicap at Lingfield last time; steps up further in distance.

runners.breeder: G Hedley & Mike Channon Bloodstock Ltd
runners.comment: Failed to get home in C&D event last week; yet to win beyond 1m4f
runners.name: Gearings Point
runners.spotlight: Failed to get home in C&D event last week, extending a long losing spell, and again seems likely to be outstayed; still seeking first win beyond 1m4f; headgear applied.

runners.comment: Record is just 1-16; needs to step up on latest effort (sixth over C&D)
runners.name: Forglen
runners.spotlight: Record is just 1-16, the success at Wolverhampton (1m6f) last July; has made the frame a few times since but finished only sixth over C&D last week; needs to step up on that latest effort.

runners.comment: Has failed to back up the form of his account-opening win at Southwell
runners.name: Fornido
runners.spotlight: Prevailed narrowly at Southwell (1m6f) in October for account-opening win; however, has failed to back up that form in two outings since, latest when a 40-1 shot over C&D; not solid.

runners.comment: Placed several times but is still a maiden at the age of seven
runners.name: Lumberjack
runners.spotlight: Placed several times, including 7l second at Chelmsford (1m5f) on reappearance; has each-way hopes but looks far from guaranteed to go one better, being still a maiden at the age of seven.

runners.comment: Multiple C&D winner but dropped away and failed to beat a rival last time
runners.name: Smith
runners.spotlight: Seven wins over C&D, the most recent in December 2024; made the frame twice last autumn but dropped away and failed to beat a rival in latest outing; not fully sure what to expect.

runners.comment: Opened her account in latest hurdles start; respected off current mark back on Flat
runners.name: Girl Of Gold
runners.spotlight: Bit of promise at a modest level on the Flat; hung badly right but opened her account at Fakenham (2m7f) in latest hurdles start; respected off current mark assuming she transfers the form back to this code.

runners.comment: Some promise this year but needs additional progress upped to 2m
runners.name: Karismatique
runners.spotlight: Six-race maiden who has shaped with some promise in a couple of middle-distance handicaps this year, latest at Kempton three days ago; needs additional progress upped further in trip, however.

12:40.race_name: Midnite, Building The Future Of Betting Handicap

runners.comment: Big chance on last year's best efforts and this is a drop in class; solid claims
runners.name: Completely Random
runners.spotlight: Looked a candidate for top sprint handicap honours last spring and his close fifth in the Wokingham came off a 5lb higher mark than today's; didn't run badly on his final two starts in 2025 and he is back in calmer waters on this return from a 73-day break; Ryan Moore booked and a big run is expected.

runners.comment: Needs to step up on last year's efforts but down in class and too soon to write off
runners.name: Bolo Neighs
runners.spotlight: Useful 2yo; not at his best in two runs this winter but he has dropped 4lb and last time isn't the run to judge him on (too keen in a race not run to suit); not solid but too soon to write him off.

runners.comment: Outclassed Class 4 opposition latest; up 7lb but doubt he's handicapped out  of it
runners.name: Zoulu Chief
runners.spotlight: Not sure whether the gelding operation or the drop in the weights kickstarted his revival but he had been threatening prior to outclassing Class 4 opposition at Wolverhampton in November; up 7lb but one to take seriously.

runners.comment: Completed AW hat-trick when winning at Chelmsford last month; up 3lb against better horses
runners.name: Justcallmepete
runners.spotlight: Arrives in top form, completing a 6f AW hat-trick when landing a valuable Chelmsford handicap last month; 3lb rise not insurmountable but while this is officially a drop in class, that latest Class 2 was effectively a 0-85; others appeal more.

runners.breeder: D & S L Tanker Transport Ltd
runners.comment: C&D win last month was followed by a lesser run at Wolverhampton; others look stronger
runners.name: Intervention
runners.spotlight: Well backed when winning over C&D last month; failed to back it up at Wolverhampton 18 days ago and others are more appealing.

runners.breeder: Mme Isabelle Mauger & Mr Guy Benachour
runners.comment: Beaten in two handicaps since his selling-race win at Southwell; now gets cheekpieces
runners.name: Dyrholaey
runners.spotlight: Readily saw off Prince Of Pillo in a Southwell seller in November but 9lb worse off with that rival today and two subsequent handicap runs have seen him finish unplaced; cheekpieces now reached for.

runners.comment: None too consistent and could prove vulnerable back up in class
runners.name: Prince Of Pillo
runners.spotlight: Not out of it on his best form but consistency isn't his strongest suit; up in class and others appeal more for win purposes.

13:15.race_name: BetMGM Winter Oaks Fillies' Handicap (GBBPlus Race)

runners.comment: Quickened smartly to win over C&D last month; major player up 3lb
runners.name: Morrophore
runners.spotlight: The winner of three of her seven starts, the latest when picking up smartly to lead close home over C&D last month; up another 3lb but bred to be a Pattern-race performer and holds obvious claims.

runners.comment: 5-5 on AW; up in weights but today's new trip could spark extra from her (dam 1m4f winner)
runners.name: Sky Safari
runners.spotlight: 5-5 on AW, completing a hat-trick when gamely winning a Listed race over 1m here eight weeks ago; the second home there was an unconsidered 125-1 shot who went into the race with a BHA mark of 71 so there are question marks over it but the third home ran well in Listed company in France last month; now 10lb higher than for her Kempton win on her penultimate start but she could progress further now upped in trip (dam a 1m4f winner); contender.

runners.comment: A better mare now than when 6th in this race in 2025 but rated accordingly; stamina query
runners.name: Unassuming
runners.spotlight: Looked stretched by this trip when sixth of 12 in the corresponding race 12 months ago; rated 14lb higher this time around but she's earned it, winning three times since; cheekpieces now given a go but suspicion she'll prove vulnerable to stronger stayers.

runners.comment: Below par on soft when last seen but still unexposed and brings potential to this AW debut
runners.name: Wujjood
runners.spotlight: Progressive form in novice company last summer, winning at Pontefract before chasing home subsequent Group 1 winner Consent at Newbury (1m2f, good); only fifth in Listed company on her next outing but still ran to a useful level; possible soft ground was no good to her when last seen and she is an intriguing contender now switched to AW.

runners.comment: Chasing a hat-trick but up in the weights and she has the widest stall to contend with
runners.name: Lady Of Arabia
runners.spotlight: 2-2 since visored, following a 1m2f Chelmsford win with a ready success at Wolverhampton last month (9.5f); up 4lb and drawn widest so she will need to produce another personal best to complete her hat-trick.

runners.comment: Fourth behind Morrophore over C&D last month; should make another bold bid
runners.name: True Colors
runners.spotlight: Got first run on her rivals when fourth in a C&D event 45 days ago but she weakened in the final furlong, eventually beaten 1.5l into fourth; should make another bold bid.

runners.comment: Yet to win on AW but runner-up over 1m4f here in both starts for new yard; each-way shout
runners.name: Kimeko Glory
runners.spotlight: 0-6 on AW as opposed to 3-7 on turf but her two runs here for Charles Hills this winter confirm she's fully effective on the surface; drops back to 1m2f and needs a career best to win but more minor money not out of the question.

runners.comment: Her turf win last year came in a muddling race and well beaten twice after; tough task
runners.name: Thankyou Baroness
runners.spotlight: Made successful handicap debut at Doncaster (1m4f, good to firm) last June but that was a slowly-run small-field Class 5 event and she was well beaten twice afterwards; returns from four-month break in a tough race.

runners.comment: 5lb out of the weights and she wasn't at her best in a lesser race last time; opposable
runners.name: Aiming High
runners.spotlight: 1m4f turf win here last September; ended 2025 with three AW defeats though and she looks booked for a struggle from 5lb out of the handicap in this useful event.

runners.comment: Running okay of late but this is a tough assignment from 6lb out of the handicap
runners.name: Bint Al Daar
runners.spotlight: She's run some fair races for this yard but needs to leave recent efforts well behind her if she's to win this from 6lb out of the handicap.

13:55.race_name: Bet £10 Get £40 With BetMGM Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Winning debut (7f, Tapeta) in November; that form has been well advertised; not ruled out
runners.name: Pinatubos Legacy
runners.spotlight: Good sprinting pedigree and he rewarded market support in a 7f novice at Newcastle in November, showing a fine attitude; the front two pulled over 3l clear of the remainder and the third, fourth and fifth have all won since; has a big weight to carry but he shouldn't be underestimated.

runners.comment: 2-2, both wins on AW (7f and 6f); ready win for new connections latest; more to come
runners.name: Jungle Ruler
runners.spotlight: Won a 7f maiden at Dundalk for Joseph O'Brien last October; strong favourite and readily justified that confidence with a comfortable Southwell win on his debut for new connections two weeks ago (6f); double penalty to shoulder but he's a leading contender.

runners.comment: Strong form when winning a 6f novice at Salisbury last June; off since but 7f sure to suit
runners.name: Factual
runners.spotlight: Got up late to win a 6f novice at Salisbury last June and that form has been well advertised since; looks sure to benefit from the extra furlong and he's open to plenty of improvement; solid claims back from a break.

runners.comment: $65,000 yearling; dam a useful 6f winner; enough paper appeal to warrant a market check
runners.name: All You Can Be
runners.spotlight: $65,000 yearling; fourth foal of a French 2yo/US 6f winner (RPR 100), herself a sister to Group 1 winner Shale; starts out in a competitive race but he looks the part on paper.

runners.comment: 42,000gns yearling; dam a 6f 2yo AW winner in Canada; one of two newcomers for the stable
runners.name: Bennyworth
runners.spotlight: 42,000gns yearling; second foal of a 6f 2yo AW winner in Canada, herself from a good family; one of two newcomers for his connections; betting can provide clues.

runners.comment: Useful middle-distance pedigree but there's a fair standard to aim at and may need further
runners.name: Charles Darnay
runners.spotlight: Eighth foal; half-brother to winners Land Of Oz (1m6f-2m including AW; RPR 99), Environment Amigo (1m6f/16.5f AW; 87) and Stanley Baldwin (Qatari 7f/10.5f); dam 1m2f winner (100); bred to have a future but 7f around here may prove on the sharp side.

runners.comment: Two promising runs in AW novices last month; should make another bold bid
runners.name: Northern Empire
runners.spotlight: Two encouraging runs in Polytrack novices last month, finishing second (beaten 3l) over 1m here 26 days ago; the winner there looked promising and the fourth has won since so the form has ballast; one to consider.

runners.comment: Well beaten in two 7f AW runs last year; no appeal in this field
runners.name: Bear Steps
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in two 7f AW runs last year; no appeal in this field.

14:30.race_name: Midnite Are Upping The Betting Game Handicap (Div I)

runners.comment: Slow start scuppered Wednesday's bid for a four-timer; down in class but 5lb higher today
runners.name: Gogo Yubari
runners.spotlight: Having a fine winter, winning four times, but a slow start scuppered her bid for a four-timer here on Wednesday; drops back into Class 6 company but she is effectively 5lb higher today.

runners.comment: 21lb better off with Gogo Yubari on 5f run ten days ago; return to 6f a plus; contender
runners.name: Harry Brown
runners.owner: Peter Crate And Gallagher Bloodstock Ltd
runners.spotlight: Fourth of five behind Gogo Yubari here ten days ago but he is a whopping 21lb better off today; should go well back up in trip.

runners.comment: Well backed when winning over C&D before Christmas; still feasibly treated up 6lb
runners.name: Watermelon Sugar
runners.spotlight: His last three wins have come over C&D, the latest when well backed 26 days ago; still well treated on his best form despite the 6lb rise; betting to guide.

runners.comment: Out of sorts for current yard; drops in grade with headgear returned but still risky
runners.name: Griselda
runners.spotlight: Barely beaten a rival in four runs for this yard, including over C&D two weeks ago (first run after a wind op); drops in class with headgear returned but still not easily recommended.

runners.comment: Arrives in good form and the booking of Billy Loughnane is a positive; solid chance
runners.name: Pinjarra
runners.spotlight: Front-runner; saw off a big field at Southwell in October and found just one too strong at Kempton last month (both 6f); Billy Loughnane booked and he should remain competitive.

runners.comment: Change of tactics didn't work here ten days ago but he remains on an appealing mark
runners.name: Southbank
runners.spotlight: Ready win at Kempton (6f) last October and shaped with more promise than the distance beaten suggests next time; change of tactics didn't work here ten days ago and he's on a favourable mark; shortlisted.

runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khans Studs S C
runners.comment: Poor strike-rate; ran well at Kempton last time but far from certain to back it up
runners.name: Haziym
runners.spotlight: Infrequent winner but he arrives on the back of a good third at Kempton; overall profile suggests he is no banker to follow it with another good run.

runners.comment: Ended 2025 quietly but on a good mark if a break has freshened her up
runners.name: Rumba Bay
runners.spotlight: She wasn't at her best when last seen in the autumn but that has resulted in her returning to action off a good mark; this looks quite a warm race though.

runners.comment: Best run for a while when 3rd over C&D last week; that was a 0-50 and this demands more
runners.name: Porfin
runners.spotlight: Multiple winner down the years and he ran his best race for a while when third of nine in a classified event over C&D last week; this demands more.

15:05.race_name: Midnite Are Upping The Betting Game Handicap (Div II)

runners.comment: Two 7f defeats this month but still looked in form when fourth on Wednesday; respected
runners.name: Up The Anti
runners.spotlight: Won two of her last three runs in 2025, over 5.7f and 6f, and this month's two defeats have come over 7f; not seen to best effect at Kempton on Wednesday and shaped as though still in form; respected.

runners.comment: On losing run but he ended 2025 with some solid efforts over 5f; more appealing than many
runners.name: Bluebells Boy
runners.spotlight: Without a win since October 2024 but he ended 2025 with some good runs for this yard; steps back up in trip; more appealing than many.

runners.comment: On last winning mark and not beaten far on Tuesday; B Loughnane a good booking for yard
runners.name: Em Jay Kay
runners.spotlight: 6f win at Newcastle off this mark in November; not beaten far over 5f back at Newcastle on Tuesday; ability to feature and Billy Loughnane a positive booking for the yard (four wins and five placed runners from 15 rides).

runners.comment: 11-race maiden but down in the weights and recent reappearance was OK; each-way shout
runners.name: Dark Sun
runners.spotlight: 0-11 but she did run well on a few occasions last summer; this month's return from a short break was encouraging enough and she has dropped to a career-low mark.

runners.comment: Well beaten on her last two starts and the drop to sprinting isn't the obvious answer
runners.name: Lady Kameko
runners.spotlight: Ten-race maiden; finished second at Bath last September but that was 1m on heavy ground; too much to prove dropped in trip.

runners.breeder: Scea Marmion Vauville Ecurie Skymarc Fa
runners.comment: Poor strike-rate but latest run was okay and he lurks on a dangerous mark
runners.name: Alashos
runners.spotlight: The winner of just one of his 19 starts; hasn't been with this yard all that long and he has slipped 9lb down the weights; latest run wasn't too bad and he's not discounted.

runners.comment: Optimum trip yet to be established; unconvincing record and easy enough to swerve
runners.name: Fitzmaurice
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in all eight starts; couldn't go the pace dropped to 5f here ten days ago (blinkered first time); dropped 5lb but plenty to prove.

runners.comment: Ended losing run in a 0-50 at Wolverhampton 11 days ago; 1lb rise seems fair; contender
runners.name: East Tyrone
runners.owner: Alan And David Fairhurst And P Kirby
runners.spotlight: The drop into a 0-50 classified event and a change of headgear saw him belatedly add to his 2yo win when gamely scoring at Wolverhampton 11 days ago; that wasn't a bad race of its type (third won since) and a 1lb rise could have been tougher.

15:40.race_name: Midnite A Next Generation Betting App Handicap

runners.comment: Kept on well for a close 4th over C&D last week; solid claims off the same mark
runners.name: Meet Me In Meraki
runners.owner: Spiers & Hartwell Ltd & Mrs E Evans
runners.spotlight: Putting in good late work over C&D last week, beaten 0.5l at the finish; runs off the same mark and should give it another good go.

runners.breeder: S A R L Haras De Saint Julien
runners.comment: Behind Meet Me In Meraki last week but running himself back into form; not discounted
runners.name: Lennys Spirit
runners.spotlight: Won twice on turf here last summer; running himself into form this winter, most recently beaten 2l over C&D last week (behind Meet Me In Meraki); back to a winning mark and not dismissed.

runners.comment: 0-10 and proving expensive to follow; drops in trip after modest effort last time
runners.name: Eupator
runners.owner: Middleham Park Racing I and Partner
runners.spotlight: Ten-race maiden who has been expensive to follow; latest run wasn't his best and hopes rest on the drop in trip having a positive effect.

runners.comment: Promise in 1m maidens here last summer; poor hurdle form since; tough opening mark
runners.name: Dodging The Bullet
runners.spotlight: Showed some promise in 1m maidens here last summer; poor hurdle form since and although this should be more suitable, he doesn't leap off the page as being well handicapped.

runners.comment: Proving expensive to follow but the addition of a hood can help and still has low mileage
runners.name: Kings Hand
runners.spotlight: Near miss on his handicap debut at Wolverhampton (9.5f) in October but he has beaten as favourite (or joint favourite) in three runs since; the addition of a hood could help him settle better and in the context of this race he is unexposed.

runners.comment: Best run for new yard when 3rd at Wolverhampton 18 days ago; has something to build on now
runners.name: Riyadh Gem
runners.spotlight: Not been with Faye Bramley long and there were signs of a revival when third, albeit beaten 4l, at Wolverhampton (9.5f) 18 days ago; now has something to build on.

runners.comment: Last 1m2f run saw him win at Brighton; back from three months off; fair mark
runners.name: Bohemian Breeze
runners.spotlight: 1m2f Flat win last summer; campaigned over further since then and he has generally performed with credit; absent since a fair hurdle effort three weeks ago.

runners.comment: AW hat-trick (last two over C&D) in December; risen 17lb and now upped in class; chance
runners.name: Tommys Promise
runners.spotlight: He's found a surge of improvement in recent weeks, getting off the mark at Chelmsford last month and following that breakthrough success with two C&D wins; now 17lb higher than for the first win and he steps out of Class 6 company today; still needs taking seriously.

runners.comment: C&D win in October; fair third here last month; more needed upped in class
runners.name: Muy Muy Loco
runners.spotlight: Tricky customer but he arrived on the scene late and fast to win a C&D handicap last October; similar form when third back here last month; a career best is required.

12:55.race_name: South West Rail Solutions Ltd EBF "National Hunt" Maiden Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Struggled when a big-priced outsider for first two hurdle races
runners.name: Anothermanicmonday
runners.spotlight: Struggled when a big-priced outsider for first two hurdle races, both over 2m at Exeter last month.

runners.comment: Kept on for modest third here (2m) recently but this race is much deeper
runners.name: Arnie Moon
runners.spotlight: Kept on for modest third in recent 2m maiden here (good), his second hurdling start, but contests a much deeper race today.

runners.comment: Placed in two points last May but did not show a great deal in two hurdles in the autumn
runners.name: Charlies Jetaway
runners.spotlight: Placed in two points last May but did not show a great deal on his two hurdling starts in the autumn (2m/2m5f); cheekpieces now added.

runners.comment: Bumper winner; fair form when place on both hurdling starts; likely contender again
runners.name: Doctor On Call
runners.spotlight: Won Hereford bumper (good to soft) last season and ran to fair level when placed on both hurdling starts in the autumn (2m3f/2m4f, good to soft); has another big role to play here.

runners.comment: Won Plumpton bumper last month but needs to improve to pose a threat on hurdle debut
runners.name: Five Bar Gate
runners.spotlight: Won good-ground point bumper last season and built upon fairly encouraging rules debut when winning run-of-the-mill Plumpton bumper (soft) last month; has a future over jumps but probably needs to improve here.

runners.comment: Pulled up in three of his four points and can only be watched on rules debut
runners.name: Georges Street
runners.spotlight: Placed in fast-ground Irish point last May but pulled up in two British points in the autumn and can only be watched on rules debut.

runners.comment: 2-2 in bumpers; second to smart rival on hurdle debut; below form since; still respected
runners.name: Harbour Island
runners.spotlight: Dual bumper winner who chased home Dan Skelton's highly regarded Mydaddypaddy on seasonal/hurdle debut at Carlisle (2m1f, soft) in November; below that form when midfield in good Newbury maiden (2m, soft) later that month but moves up in trip here and remains of strong interest.

runners.comment: Promising in bumpers in early 2024; well held (bled from nose) on both hurdling starts
runners.name: Joyau Allen
runners.spotlight: Began 2024 with two very promising runs (one win) in heavy-ground Exeter bumpers but wasn't seen again until two disappointing hurdle runs this autumn (2m/2m4f; bled from the nose both times); in good hands and still has plenty of time to get career back on track but comes with obvious risk.

runners.comment: Still has potential but is yet to transfer his good bumper form to hurdles
runners.name: Kilwaughter
runners.spotlight: Irish bumper winner on Boxing Day 2024; ran well in hot bumpers at Aintree and Punchestown festivals for new stable last spring but disappointed (albeit in a Grade 2) on hurdle debut in October and was just a respectable fourth at Exeter (2m, good to soft) last month; still has potential but needs to take a good step forward here.

runners.comment: Remote fifth when 150-1 for last month's hurdle debut at Hereford
runners.name: King Sacre
runners.spotlight: Remote fifth when 150-1 for last month's hurdle debut at Hereford (2m3f, good to soft); hood (worn in one of his bumpers) refitted here.

runners.comment: Shaped with promise when seventh in good Newbury maiden hurdle but needs improvement here
runners.name: Nice One Eric
runners.spotlight: Fourth in good-ground Worcester bumper on debut in October and also showed significant promise before weakening into seventh (just behind Harbour Island) in good Newbury maiden hurdle (2m, soft) in November; needs improvement over this longer trip but well worth keeping an eye on with the future in mind.

runners.comment: Well beaten at triple-digit odds in two bumpers this season
runners.name: Play On Court
runners.spotlight: Well beaten at triple-digit odds in two bumpers this season; makes hurdling debut here.

runners.comment: Placed four times in Ireland last summer and ran well in recent Listed race for new stable
runners.name: October Hill
runners.spotlight: Placed in four consecutive Irish maiden hurdles for Colin Bowe last summer (2m-2m4f, good-yielding) and was very respectable fourth in Listed mares' novice here (2m, good) for new stable last month; back up in trip today and will probably be on the premises again.

runners.comment: Placed in Irish point in 2024 but tailed off when reappearing in a bumper last month
runners.name: Shanagolden Girl
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in good-ground Irish point in November 2024 but tailed off (albeit on soft ground) when reappearing in Exeter bumper last month; probably best watched on hurdle debut.

13:32.race_name: Martin Baker's 60th Birthday Bash Mares' "National Hunt" Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Disappointed on 2m5f hurdling debut but there were positives to take from  her bumper runs
runners.name: Beauty In The Park
runners.spotlight: Ran okay in her two bumpers (good to soft/heavy) but, following wind surgery, her hurdling debut at Wincanton was very underwhelming and 2m5f shouldn't have been an issue on breeding; still early days.
