runners.comment: Competitive in points but tailed off and pulled up in her two runs over hurdles; opposable
runners.name: Bees Kiss
runners.spotlight: Competitive in points but tailed off and pulled up in her two runs over hurdles; opposable.

runners.comment: Bumper winner and 2nd on hurdling debut; 2m4f was perhaps too far last time
runners.name: Chatty Girl
runners.spotlight: Newbury bumper winner who was runner-up on her hurdling introduction at Windsor (2m, good to soft) and didn't get home over 2m4f at Southwell last time; back in trip here and probably capable of winning a race of this nature.

runners.comment: Good-ground bumper winner who brings plenty of potential to hurdling career
runners.name: Eremenko
runners.spotlight: Closely related to the same connections' smart hurdler Doddiethegreat; readily justified favouritism in a good-ground bumper at Southwell and travelled well before cutting out on a soft surface at Cheltenham (Listed); brings plenty of potential to hurdling career.

runners.comment: Down the field in her two bumpers, the latest here in November; hard to recommend
runners.name: Four Decades
runners.spotlight: Down the field in her two bumpers, the latest here in November; hard to recommend.

runners.comment: Out of a winning hurdler; the only runner without experience and likely best watched
runners.name: Gilded Glance
runners.spotlight: Dam placed 1m4f Flat (RPR 53)/2m-2m5f hurdle winner, half-sister to winners Jelly Baby (1m4f), Alasao (2m1f/2m3f hurdle) and Maisie Day (point); the only runner without experience and likely best watched.

runners.comment: Point/bumper winner last season; hasn't hit the ground running over hurdles
runners.name: Heron In The Park
runners.spotlight: Point/bumper winner last season; hasn't hit the ground running over hurdles (hooded the last twice) and was 14-1 when departing mid-race in a Kempton maiden on Boxing Day; bit to prove right now.

runners.comment: Beaten under 7l in a novice hurdle for mares at Catterick over Christmas
runners.name: Klassy Pearl
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in two Irish points and beaten under 7l in a novice hurdle for mares at Catterick over Christmas (1m7f, good); that's something she might well build on.

runners.comment: Competitive in her two bumpers but at 22-1 she was soon left behind in a Hereford maiden
runners.name: Lyrical Choice
runners.spotlight: Competitive in her two bumpers but at 22-1 she was soon left behind in a Hereford maiden; has to step up on that form.

runners.comment: Bought for £100,000 after point win; tongue-tie added after a 13l bumper defeat
runners.name: No Risk Today
runners.spotlight: Bought for £100,000 after winning an Irish point; had wind surgery prior to rules debut in a bumper here and was beaten 13l in the end (on good to firm); today's conditions may suit better and a tongue-tie is added.

runners.comment: Weak in the betting for both runs over hurdles and hasn't featured
runners.name: Renes Walk
runners.spotlight: Hinted at a future in bumpers but weak in the betting for both runs over hurdles and hasn't featured; might be one for handicaps.

runners.comment: Bought for £50,000 last May after winning two points; beaten 10l in both her bumpers
runners.name: Shes Delighted
runners.spotlight: Bought for £50,000 last May after winning two points; beaten 10l in both her bumpers and wouldn't be the obvious answer on her hurdling debut.

runners.breeder: M Larobe P Thiriet & R Gourmau
runners.comment: Well held in a Listed race here last time; previous second at Warwick brings her into it
runners.name: Miss Carbo
runners.spotlight: Second in two French juvenile hurdles and filled the same berth on British debut at Warwick (2m maiden, good to soft); 16-1 and well beaten in a Listed race here 18 days ago when fitted in a hood (retained) and cheekpieces; each-way claims on that penultimate effort.

runners.comment: Needed to show more in a Hereford bumper (16-1) to be seriously fancied for this
runners.name: Uptons Mighty Oak
runners.spotlight: Needed to show more in a Hereford bumper (16-1) to be seriously fancied for this.

14:05.race_name: Stag Environmental Polaris Dealer Devon / Somerset Novices' Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Only sixth at Market Rasen on Friday when bidding for a hat-trick
runners.name: Avada Kedavra
runners.spotlight: Back from a break in good form and followed up his C&D win (good to firm) by accounting for three finishers at Plumpton (3m1f, good to soft); essentially off the same mark here with James Turner claiming his 5lb, but he was only sixth at Market Rasen on Friday.

runners.comment: 40-1 and tailed off on British debut in a 2m2f Exeter handicap; plenty to prove
runners.name: Lion Of The Desert
runners.spotlight: Seven-race maiden in Ireland; 40-1 and tailed off on British debut in a 2m2f Exeter handicap; plenty to prove, including stamina.

runners.comment: Solid chance with her runner-up in 2m4f soft-ground handicaps the last twice
runners.name: Smile Back
runners.spotlight: Solid chance with her runner-up in 2m4f soft-ground handicaps the last twice, provided she stays; did win a 3m point.

runners.comment: Wouldn't be a guaranteed stayer over this far on handicap debut
runners.name: Ribba Hill
runners.owner: Syd Hosie Racing Syndicate - Ribba Hill
runners.spotlight: 1m4f winner for previous yard; some promise in 2m/2m3f novices here but wouldn't be a guaranteed stayer over this far on handicap debut.

runners.comment: Quiet so far but this is her handicap debut; stable won this last year with a similar type
runners.name: Kilworth
runners.spotlight: Point winner (3m); hasn't been an instant hit under rules but Sean Bowen is booked for this handicap debut and yard's winner of this last year had a similar profile.

runners.comment: Tailed off at Wincanton last time; in a top yard but the positives stop there
runners.name: Its A Breeze
runners.spotlight: No improvement when remote third in farcical race on seasonal/handicap debut at Plumpton (2m4f, good) and then finished tailed off at Wincanton; in a top yard but the positives stop there.

runners.comment: Third and beaten 10l on his handicap debut at Wincanton (3m) and has been dropped 1lb
runners.name: Snapdance
runners.spotlight: Third and beaten 10l on his handicap debut at Wincanton (3m, good to soft) and has been dropped 1lb; may need more but that's feasible given he's so lightly raced.

runners.comment: A winning pointer and entitled to show more with his stamina now stretched out
runners.name: Tell The Tale
runners.spotlight: Beaten 29l on switch to handicaps at Doncaster but that was over 2m3f and he did win a 3m Irish point on soft ground; entitled to show more with his stamina now stretched out.

runners.comment: 5lb higher than for latest near miss and wouldn't want the ground to soften up too much
runners.name: Square Du Roule
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at Exeter in November (2m5f, good to soft) and very nearly went in again over C&D 18 days ago (good); raised 5lb for that near miss and wouldn't want the ground to soften up too much.

runners.comment: Running well in the summer and her Bangor conqueror was well handicapped
runners.name: Newmill Getaway
runners.spotlight: Absent since June but was running well back then and her Bangor conqueror was well handicapped; 3lb higher here but firmly in the mix.

runners.comment: 0-4 for current yard but this longer trip may help with her pointing background
runners.name: Jewel Of Windsor
runners.spotlight: Formerly with Emmet Mullins; 0-4 for current yard and hasn't been that involved in those races, all handicaps at up to 2m3f; this longer trip may help with her pointing background.

runners.comment: Longstanding maiden but running well until getting stuck in the mud last time
runners.name: Nowyouvebinandunit
runners.spotlight: Longstanding maiden but bang there in two 2m5f handicaps at Fontwell (good to soft; in cheekpieces) before struggling there last time on heavy (first-time visor); can be given another chance; 2lb wrong but a 3lb claimer takes over.

runners.comment: Pulled up on handicap debut in May 2024 when a 100-1 chance; off since and he's 6lb wrong
runners.name: Brucie Bonus
runners.spotlight: Pulled up on handicap debut in May 2024 when a 100-1 chance; off since and he's 6lb wrong.

runners.comment: 0-13 under rules; 80-1 when pulled up in latest handicap; 7lb out of the weights
runners.name: Emberscombe
runners.spotlight: Dual point winner who is 0-13 under rules; 80-1 when pulled up in latest handicap; 7lb out of the weights.

14:43.race_name: Gaynor Carr Memorial Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Recent C&D winner who will take some catching if getting into a rhythm up front
runners.name: Hypotenus
runners.spotlight: Had three runs following wind surgery and two of them positive, here last time jumping well in front and coming home clear (2m, good); can probably cope with this 6lb higher mark and he handles softer ground.

runners.comment: Back from a break to win three of his four handicaps under Rian Corcoran; up another 6lb
runners.name: Jaipaletemps
runners.spotlight: Back from a break to win three of his four handicaps under Rian Corcoran and they did it readily at Lingfield latest (2m, good to soft); he's up another 6lb and the jockey claimed 10lb last time, but clearly a strong contender.

runners.comment: Quiet British debut but now hooded and he won twice over fences in France
runners.name: Raffles Hermes
runners.spotlight: Won twice over fences in France; joined this yard for 30,000euros; beaten 21l into seventh on British debut at Exeter (2m3f, good to soft; 11-1) but that was after a break of 162 days and a hood now goes on; may fare better.

runners.breeder: E U R L Agb Agency & Mrs D Billebaut
runners.comment: Quiet on handicap/chase debut at Bangor; now in cheekpieces; others look safer
runners.name: Jack Black
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 6yo who has had two races since returning from a year out and his handicap/chase debut at Bangor last time was forgettable; now in cheekpieces and others look safer.

runners.comment: Did well to win on chase debut at Doncaster and is only 3lb higher here
runners.name: Cuban Court
runners.spotlight: Won three times over hurdles last season and made a winning debut over fences at Doncaster (2m, good to soft) despite the odd mistake; that's fair form given how well the second fared the time before; just 3lb higher.

runners.comment: Modest hurdler and has too much to prove on a few counts now tackling fences
runners.name: Holy Legend
runners.spotlight: Modest hurdler and both his third places were remote; has too much to prove on a few counts now tackling fences.

runners.comment: Hard to win with but he's in solid form and has the benefit of Sean Bowen's assistance
runners.name: Valirann Gold
runners.spotlight: Finds winning hard but he's in a fairly good run of form, for all that he was last to finish in an eventful race at Exeter last time; has a light weight and the benefit of Sean Bowen, so much respected.

15:15.race_name: Claim Your DragonBet Welcome Offer Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Won this race in 2021 and has since added three Grade 2s; recent efforts not too shoddy
runners.name: Brewinupastorm
runners.spotlight: Won this race in 2021 and has since added three Grade 2s; now a 13yo but he's not run at all badly in two Aintree handicaps following a long absence and he's not without hope.

runners.comment: Last year's winner; some doubts over his current wellbeing but couldn't dismiss
runners.name: Aurigny Mill
runners.spotlight: Chasing aspirations soon aborted after his Kempton fall; the last of his five wins over hurdles was in this race 12 months ago and he's only 2lb higher now; there are some doubts over his current wellbeing but he can't be dismissed; tries cheekpieces.

runners.comment: Solid enough efforts in this discipline the last twice; 7lb claim is welcomed
runners.name: Bourbali
runners.owner: W Pope E Legg M Green & T Swaffield
runners.spotlight: Mixes chasing with hurdling and consistent in the main; solid enough efforts in this discipline the last twice and Rian Corcoran's claim will come in handy; fine on all ground.

runners.comment: Only 5lb higher than when doing it well at Plumpton and that was also after a break
runners.name: Walk On High
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage and consistent 9yo; odds-on in winning two minor races last spring (heavy/good) and back from 170 days off to take a Plumpton handicap (2m4f, good) without too much fuss; only 5lb higher and subsequent break might be a good thing.

runners.comment: High in the weights so booking Chad Bament with his 7lb claim makes sense
runners.name: Celtic Art
runners.spotlight: A 3l winner over C&D in December and ran just as well in defeat back here nine days ago; perhaps a shade high in the weights so booking Chad Bament with his 7lb claim makes sense; versatile ground-wise.

15:50.race_name: Support Retraining Of Racehorses (ROR) Handicap Chase

runners.comment: Had a chance when unseating two runs back; let down by his jumping at Ludlow
runners.name: Staff Sergeant Len
runners.spotlight: Not bred for this game but had every chance when unseating late on at Wincanton on Boxing Day (2m4f); let down by his jumping at Ludlow and he's unproven over this far.

runners.comment: 2m3f too short on chase debut so reason to believe he can fare better now
runners.name: Bataillon
runners.spotlight: Nine-race maiden; 2m3f was perhaps too short when beaten 29l on chase debut a month ago and his previous defeat over hurdles was after an absence; there are reasons to believe he can up his game here.

runners.comment: Knows how to win, arrives in good form and goes well for Lucy Turner
runners.name: Faitque de LIsle
runners.spotlight: Regularly ridden by Lucy Turner, as when winning twice over 3m at Ludlow (good to soft/soft) last February and again at Uttoxeter (3m, good) in October; good runs have followed and another one is highly likely.

runners.comment: Running well until last time but he remains on a realistic mark if bouncing back
runners.name: Zacony Rebel
runners.spotlight: Second and first in small-field handicap chases at about this trip at Huntingdon before a heavy defeat there just before Christmas; remains on a realistic mark if bouncing back.

runners.comment: Hurdle/chase winner so he's capable but has looked a hard ride in his last two races
runners.name: Edgewell
runners.spotlight: Both British wins have been in staying handicap hurdles but he won over fences in Ireland; a good run in this discipline behind School For Scandal at Windsor in November (first-time blinkers) but he's looked a hard ride in his last two races.

runners.comment: Had made a pleasing start in this discipline only to underperform the last twice
runners.name: Lough Owel
runners.spotlight: No closer than 6.5l in five runs over fences but had made a pleasing start in this discipline only to underperform the last twice; cheekpieces tried last time are removed.

runners.comment: There's a bit of all or nothing about him but he's won two of his last four races
runners.name: School For Scandal
runners.owner: K Johns & Joe Tickle Racing Club
runners.spotlight: There's a bit of all or nothing about him but he's won two of his last four races and could shrug off his poor effort last time; not handicapped out of it; runner-up in this last year.

runners.comment: Maiden; questionable what he achieved with a well-held third at Fontwell the last time
runners.name: Daring Plan
runners.owner: Miss Jane Edgar & D V Gardner
runners.spotlight: Still a maiden and questionable what he achieved with a well-held third at Fontwell the last time; that was on heavy ground and a less taxing surface would assist, but others appeal more.

runners.comment: Each-way claims on her good-ground form but even good to soft seems troublesome
runners.name: Sweet Nightingale
runners.spotlight: Each-way claims on her good-ground form but even good to soft seems troublesome and she's not a certain stayer over this far.

runners.comment: Runner-up over hurdles latest but an infrequent winner who can be inconsistent
runners.name: Watchoutitscookie
runners.spotlight: Runner-up over hurdles last time in November (2m4f, good) but he's an infrequent winner who can be inconsistent; has won over fences.

runners.comment: Below best last time but comeback run was okay and he wouldn't be exposed just yet
runners.name: Steal The Moves
runners.spotlight: Respectable fourth on seasonal/chase/handicap debut at Lingfield (2m7f, good) but failed to build on that promise at Leicester; remains a relatively unexposed 6yo.

runners.comment: First run under rules since 2022 when beaten 13l in a 3m handicap hurdle in December
runners.name: Holkham Hall
runners.spotlight: Dual point winner; first run under rules since 2022 when beaten 13l in a 3m handicap hurdle in December (raced freely); finished tailed off on only previous run over regulation fences in Ireland; unconvincing.

runners.comment: Close up in 2m5f/3m2f handicaps the last twice and looks a player
runners.name: Ted The Thief
runners.spotlight: Winning pointer; early days with this yard and as a chaser; close up in 2m5f/3m2f handicaps the last twice and looks a player.

runners.comment: Insufficient promise over hurdles to be of any great interest on this chasing debut
runners.name: Break Heart Hill
runners.spotlight: Insufficient promise over hurdles to be of any great interest on this chasing debut; cheekpieces added.

runners.comment: Showed little over hurdles at up to 2m7f and again on his switch to fences at Exeter
runners.name: Alderley Charlie
runners.spotlight: Showed little over hurdles at up to 2m7f and again on his switch to fences at Exeter; very opposable from out of the weights with cheekpieces tried.

16:20.race_name: 3 February Sporting Clubs Raceday Handicap Hurdle

runners.breeder: S C E A Haras Du Honguenet
runners.comment: Well beaten on handicap debut but fared better when sixth in blinkers on Boxing Day
runners.name: Good For You
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on last month's handicap debut (2m2f) but his staying-on sixth in first-time blinkers at Wincanton (1m7f, good to soft) on Boxing Day was much more encouraging; dropped in grade and upped in trip here; no surprise if he makes further progress.

runners.comment: Ran well in both handicaps (2m/2m3f) and is a major player again here
runners.name: Little Ledgend
runners.spotlight: Creditable fourth in 0-130 grade on handicap debut at Windsor (2m, good to soft) in November and bumped into a big improver when second at Lingfield (2m3f, soft) last month; still has potential; major player.

runners.breeder: V & F Berouards Haras Des Sablonnets &
runners.comment: Ran well in defeat over 2m here recently and might have untapped potential over this trip
runners.name: Best Night
runners.spotlight: Yet to make any significant progress since winning on hurdle debut in September but ran well in defeat here (2m, good) nine days ago and might have some untapped potential over this longer trip.

runners.comment: Unable to land a significant blow in maiden/novice hurdles but can improve in handicaps
runners.name: Bel Ombre
runners.spotlight: Showed promise in all three bumpers last season; unable to land a significant blow in three maiden/novice hurdles this term but caught the eye when keeping on steadily for modest fourth at Huntingdon (2m4f, soft) last month and is open to improvement in handicaps.

runners.comment: Now just 3lb higher than for last season's clearcut win at Wincanton (2m4f); a possible
runners.name: Prairie Diamond
runners.spotlight: Shaped well when fourth on what was effectively his seasonal debut at Southwell (2m, good to soft) last month and now just 3lb higher than for last season's clearcut win at Wincanton (2m4f, good to soft); a possible.

runners.comment: Won here last spring but may find today's trip-and-ground combination too taxing
runners.name: Taritino
runners.spotlight: Won on fast ground here (2m) last spring and returned to hurdling with respectable Wincanton run (1m7f good) in November but may find today's trip-and-ground combination too taxing.

runners.comment: Battled on for modest second in recent seller but needs a better performance here
runners.name: Bigz Belief
runners.spotlight: Battled on well for modest second in Leicester seller (2m4f, soft) last month, his second start for Fergal O'Brien, but will need a better performance on this handicap return and is evidently not as good as he was.

runners.comment: Returned from mammoth absence with 3m win last May; pulled up both runs since
runners.name: Lucky Bounce
runners.spotlight: Returned from 903-day absence with win at Ffos Las (3m, good; heavily backed) in May but was much weaker in the betting when pulled up over 2m4f on consecutive appearances in the autumn; perhaps the market will again provide a good guide here.

runners.comment: Veteran; easily brushed aside after making the running on rules return in November
runners.name: Cotton End
runners.spotlight: Veteran who had poor completion record in points last season and was easily brushed aside after making the running on rules return at Ludlow (2m5f, good) in November; revival needed.

runners.breeder: S A R L Ecuries Babsen Courses
runners.comment: Placed at big odds in November but two lesser efforts followed and he's now 0-17
runners.name: Saucats
runners.spotlight: Belied 40-1 odds when placed at Wincanton (1m7f, good) in November but two lesser efforts have followed and he's now 0-17.

runners.comment: Won over hurdles in France but soundly beaten in two British handicaps in the autumn
runners.name: Mancero
runners.spotlight: Won on hurdling debut in France last April but was soundly beaten in both British handicaps in the autumn (2m/1m7f); wore cheekpieces last time; moves up in trip and tries blinkers here.

runners.breeder: D A Hunt And A T Huckfield
runners.comment: Long in the tooth now but ran well over C&D in November; could have a say
runners.name: Sawpit Sienna
runners.spotlight: Gained two of her four hurdle wins here; getting long on the tooth now but travelled well for a long way when fifth of 13 over C&D (good to firm) in November and might be better suited by today's slower ground.

runners.breeder: Mme Sylviane Guittard Mr Geoffrey Guit
runners.comment: Went close in a point last spring but has shown no worthwhile form under rules since
runners.name: Absolut Grey
runners.owner: T Boon C Budge & W Dodd
runners.spotlight: Went close in a maiden point last spring but has not shown any worthwhile form under rules since (including two handicap runs).

runners.comment: Has not completed a race since spring 2024 and cannot be recommended
runners.name: Poets Reflection
runners.spotlight: Won over C&D in 2021 but has not completed a race since spring 2024 and cannot be recommended from 8lb out of the weights.

17:00.race_name: Read Meg Nicholls' Blog At betmgm.co.uk Handicap

runners.comment: 12-time AW winner who scored at Wolverhampton last month but he flopped there last time
runners.name: Love Your Work
runners.spotlight: Recorded his 12th AW win when scoring at Wolverhampton (8.6f) last month but he flopped under a penalty there eight days later; has bit to prove again after that heavy defeat but he has won three of his last seven starts and is capable of bouncing back.

runners.comment: 14-race maiden and he's been beaten at 5-1 or shorter on 11 occasions; others preferred
runners.name: Forest Caper
runners.spotlight: Well handicapped on his best form and he ran respectably in a C&D novice three weeks ago but he's now 0-14 and has been beaten at 5-1 or shorter on 11 occasions; others looks stronger.

runners.comment: Seven-time AW winner whose last win was off 1lb lower; dangerous if he gets a good pace
runners.name: Ernies Valentine
runners.spotlight: Seven-time AW winner who is only 1lb higher than when scoring at Wolverhampton (8.6f) in November; didn't fire at that track two weeks ago but that was against a pace bias and he's a player if this sets up for his closing style.

runners.comment: Won at Kempton in October and he ran better than bare facts over C&D latest; in the mix
runners.name: Double Time
runners.spotlight: Has patchy profile but he put in a dominant display at Kempton (1m) in October and he had some traffic issues in the closing stages when a respectable sixth over C&D last time; still looks on a workable mark and it wouldn't be a surprise if he made a bold bid.

runners.comment: On reduced mark and he's still unexposed on AW but others are more convincing
runners.name: Terries Royale
runners.spotlight: Won twice over 1m on turf as a 4yo but he generally struggled last year and was well held at Chelmsford (1m, Polytrack) last month; on reduced mark and he's still unexposed on AW but others are more convincing.

runners.comment: Triple course winner but he's lost his way and needs to turn things around
runners.name: Soames Forsyte
runners.spotlight: Triple course winner who scored at Nottingham (8.3f) in July but he's been out of sorts since then including in two runs this winter; has plenty to prove and he's a frequent slow starter.

runners.comment: Unexposed 4yo who ran well on his handicap debut at Wolverhampton; respected upped in trip
runners.name: Al Hofzan
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 4yo who went close in a Wolverhampton maiden (7f) last month and was a creditable third on handicap debut there two weeks ago; this is a deeper race but that was another step forward last time and he's open to more progress at this new trip.

runners.comment: Still lightly raced and mark is tumbling but he needs a big turnaround
runners.name: Far Ahead
runners.owner: Sporting Life Racing Club - R Fahey
runners.spotlight: Won a 7f novice at Catterick last May but he's been disappointing since and has finished tailed off in both runs this winter; still lightly raced and mark is tumbling but he needs a big turnaround.

runners.comment: Often harms his chance but racing too freely but he's on a dangerous mark; not ruled out
runners.name: Beaming Light
runners.owner: R G Robinson & R D Robinson
runners.spotlight: Often harms his chance by racing too freely, as was the case at Wolverhampton last month, but won three in a row over 1m on turf last June and is well handicapped on some of his subsequent placed form (including on Tapeta); eyeshields added.

runners.comment: On workable mark but he's struggled in his last three runs and has plenty to prove
runners.name: Havana Touch
runners.spotlight: Both wins have come over 7f but he's effective at 1m; looks feasibly treated on his Kempton win last May but he's struggled in three subsequent runs including when last of nine at Chelmsford last month; plenty to prove.

runners.comment: Now 1lb lower than for last win and has claims if he can rediscover his spark
runners.name: Mercurius Power
runners.spotlight: First three wins were on turf but last three have been on Tapeta; didn't fire at Newcastle last month but that was after a short break and he's now 1lb lower than for his last win; dangerous if he can rediscover his spark.

runners.comment: Record of 1-22 but he's been in fair form on AW last twice; not ruled out
runners.name: Miners Gamble
runners.spotlight: Sole win was on turf in August 2024 but he's only been beaten around 2l at Newcastle and Chelmsford (both at 1m) in last two runs; has possibilities if he can find something extra and he's not ruled out.

runners.comment: Down the field in three handicaps but this new trip is worth exploring; tongue-tie added
runners.name: Fermain
runners.spotlight: Made all and just held on to win a Leicester novice (6f, soft) in October; no joy in three handicaps since but she made some late headway at Lingfield (6f, AW) on New Year's Eve and this new trip looks worth exploring; tongue-tie added.

runners.comment: Reached frame in three of four qualifying runs and he needs a close look on handicap debut
runners.name: Five Cay
runners.spotlight: Reached the frame in three of his four qualifying runs, including when second of five in a Newcastle novice (1m, Tapeta) last Friday; should have more to offer now switched to handicaps and he's a half-brother to six winners; interesting contender.

runners.comment: Handicap newcomer who showed promise in novice/maiden events; needs watching in market
runners.name: Charming Doll
runners.spotlight: Showed some promise in novice/maiden events including when third at Kempton (7f, AW) on her penultimate run; faded over C&D last time but this is more realistic on handicap debut and her dam won over this trip; needs watching in market.

runners.breeder: Ecurie Haras Du Cadran Ecurie Melanie &
runners.comment: Six-race maiden and he needs improvement back up in trip
runners.name: Mr Wonka
runners.spotlight: Six-race maiden who hasn't progressed so far and was seventh of eight in a Kempton nursery (visor added) last month; wasn't beaten far in that race but he needs improvement back up in trip.

runners.comment: Won 1m novice last month and she's open to more progress on handicap debut; big player
runners.name: Beckon
runners.spotlight: Showed clear promise in her first two starts and she found more progress when winning a Newcastle novice (1m, Tapeta; 100-30) last month; looks on fair mark now switched to a handicap and this well-bred filly could continue on an upward curve; big player.

runners.comment: Landed the odds in a 1m maiden last month and he's respected on handicap debut
runners.name: Maskatto
runners.spotlight: Made the breakthrough on his step up to 1m when landing the odds in a Lingfield maiden two weeks ago; that was a last-gasp success but he pulled 7l clear with the runner-up and this opening mark looks fair; respected on handicap debut.

runners.comment: Opening mark looks on the high side but he could kick on again back at this trip
runners.name: Norcross Brow
runners.spotlight: Went close in a Pontefract novice (1m, good to soft) on his second start and he may have been stretched over 1m2f on Chelmsford reappearance last month; opening mark looks on the high side but it's still early days and he could kick on again back at this trip.

runners.comment: Just 1-11 but has a solid record in AW handicaps; should be in the mix again
runners.name: Popty Ping
runners.spotlight: Just one win from 11 starts but has form figures of 32312 in AW handicaps since November; was no match for the winner at Newcastle last time but she pulled clear of the third and this step back up in trip is no problem; should be in the mix again.

runners.comment: Inconsistent eight-race maiden and others are more convincing
runners.name: Archangel Josepi
runners.spotlight: Went close in a Newcastle nursery (1m, Tapeta) last month but she's not easy to predict and has taken two backward steps since; record is now 0-8 and others are more convincing.

runners.comment: Six-race maiden who has been up and down so far and is untried at this trip; down the list
runners.name: Crystal Aurora
runners.spotlight: Six-race maiden who has been up and down so far and was laboured after a slow start in a nursery here (7f) in November; needs to step up again after that and she's untried at this trip.

runners.breeder: Aaron Shaw Paul Shaw & Anthony Shaw
runners.comment: Unexposed filly but she needs a transformation back in trip on handicap debut
runners.name: Sweet Mabel
runners.owner: E Murchan K McConnell A & P Shaw
runners.spotlight: Finished down the field at big prices in three qualifying runs, including a 16l defeat at Wolverhampton (9.4f) last month; still early days but she needs a transformation back in trip on handicap debut.

18:00.race_name: BetMGM Supports Safer Gambling Classified Stakes (Div I)

runners.comment: Completed a double when landing a classified event here on Tuesday; major player again
runners.name: Pink Socks
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish mare who has form figures of 3411 for her current yard and she landed the odds with a comfortable win back at 7f here on Tuesday; concedes plenty of weight this time but she's on a roll and is a major player again in her hat-trick bid.

runners.comment: On long losing run but she's generally reliable and had an excuse here two weeks ago
runners.name: Balqaa
runners.spotlight: 8yo who has not won since September 2024 but she's generally reliable and had an excuse on her reappearance over C&D two weeks ago (blindfold was removed late); should be sharper this time and could get involved if she gets a good pace.

runners.comment: Just one win from 36 starts and he's been well held in last two runs; passed over
runners.name: Dash Power
runners.spotlight: Sole win from 36 starts was at Wolverhampton 12 months ago; returned to form with a second there (8.6f) last month but he's been well held in both subsequent runs and others are preferred.

runners.comment: Triple C&D winner but he's been well held here in last two runs; cheekpieces added
runners.name: Masham Moor
runners.spotlight: Three of his four wins have come over C&D but he's been laboured here in last two runs; cheekpieces are now added and he needs a major revival back in a classified event.

runners.comment: Dual C&D winner but his recent efforts have been underwhelming; first-time blinkers
runners.name: Mickey Mongoose
runners.spotlight: Often a front-runner; has gained two of his three wins over C&D, but recent efforts have been underwhelming and losing run is now up to 12; first-time blinkers.

runners.comment: Ex-French filly who is 0-18 and has finished down the field in five runs for current yard
runners.name: Shoptilyoudrop
runners.owner: James And Susan Cookson And P Kirby
runners.spotlight: Ex-French filly who is 0-18 and has finished down the field in five runs (6f-1m) for current yard; passed over.

runners.comment: Poor maiden who was well held when last seen in August; difficult to recommend
runners.name: Stoneacre
runners.spotlight: Poor maiden who was beaten 10l in a classified event when last seen in August; difficult to recommend.

runners.comment: In-form 8yo who went close in a classified event at Lingfield on Monday; respected
runners.name: Taskheer
runners.spotlight: Five-time winner who has finished placed in his last three runs including a close call in a classified event at Lingfield (1m, AW) on Monday; should give it another good shot back on Tapeta and he's respected.

runners.comment: Eight-race maiden who has yet to be placed and was well held over C&D on Tuesday
runners.name: Zaramara
runners.spotlight: Eight-race maiden who has yet to be placed and was well held in a classified event over C&D (50-1) on Tuesday; opposable.

18:30.race_name: BetMGM Supports Safer Gambling Classified Stakes (Div II)

runners.comment: Has form figures of 2112 this month; big player if he copes with this return to 1m
runners.name: Secret Road
runners.spotlight: Resurgent 8yo who has form figures of 2112 this month and was a clear second behind an improver in Chelmsford handicap (7f) on Sunday; his sole run over this trip was a long time ago but he's been strong at the finish over 7f recently and is a big player if he can continue the good work; has new owners but he's still with James Owen.

runners.comment: Just one win from last 30 starts and he's been well held here last twice; passed over
runners.name: Embarked
runners.spotlight: Just one win from his last 30 starts and he's been well held here in last two runs, including in a classified event (7f) on Tuesday; this step back up in trip is no problem but he needs a major revival; blinkers reapplied.

runners.breeder: S A R L Ecurie Des Monceaux Et Al
runners.comment: 12yo who has not won since 2023 and has plenty to prove on his return
runners.name: Mr Slicker
runners.spotlight: 12yo who has not won since 2023 and was tailed off over C&D on his last run in April; has plenty to prove on his return and this is a tough task at the weights.

runners.comment: Runner-up in both starts for current yard including a near miss over C&D; key player
runners.name: Relevant Range
runners.spotlight: Nothing like the force of old, but he's finished second in two classified events for his new yard including a near miss over C&D on his penultimate run; should be in the thick of things again and he's a key player.

runners.comment: Dual C&D winner who was an eyecatching fourth here (1m) last month; dangerous
runners.name: Spirit Of Bowland
runners.spotlight: Two of his four wins have come over C&D and he bounced back with an eyecatching fourth in a handicap here (1m) last month; usually comes from off the pace and has claims if he can build on that last run.

runners.comment: Well held at big prices in all six runs including two over 6f/7f here this month
runners.name: Summer Evening
runners.spotlight: Well held at big prices in all six runs including two over 6f/7f here this month; can only be watched back up in trip.

runners.comment: 0-18 on AW and she's been well held in classified events in last two runs; opposable
runners.name: Top Gun Tina
runners.spotlight: 6yo mare who is 0-18 on AW and she's been beaten around 6l in 1m classified events (Tapeta) in her last two runs; others preferred.

runners.comment: On long long run and he struggled on his reappearance at Newcastle last week
runners.name: Yorkstone
runners.spotlight: His last win was over C&D but that was in December 2023 and he struggled on his reappearance at Newcastle (1m classified) last week; blinkers now go on and he needs a transformation back at this track.

19:00.race_name: Always Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.breeder: B & A Kennedy & Irish National Stud
runners.comment: Well held at big prices in both runs and latest was over C&D last month; passed over
runners.name: Teggy Lasso
runners.owner: Alfa Site Services Ltd & Wendy OLeary
runners.spotlight: £50,000 breeze-up 2yo; half-brother to two winners but didn't show much in sole run for Craig Lidster in 2024 and was well held again on stable debut over C&D (40-1) last month; passed over.

runners.comment: Newbury winner who sets a clear standard under a penalty on his return; big player
runners.name: Venetian Prince
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to five winners including See The Fire (7f-1m2f including Group 2; RPR 121); made an encouraging start when sixth at Newmarket last July and he found improvement when justifying favouritism at Newbury (7f, good to firm) the following month; hasn't been seen since then but he sets a clear standard under a penalty on his return and is open to more progress on this step up in trip; strong contender.

runners.breeder: Paget Blds / Chelsea Blds / Charue Inv
runners.comment: Well held in two novice events (1m) on Polytrack last month; remains best watched for now
runners.name: Inherent Resolve
runners.spotlight: Has a good pedigree but he was well held at biggish prices in two novice events (1m) on Polytrack last month; remains best watched for now.

runners.comment: Plenty to like on paper and he needs a close look on debut
runners.name: Knowledge
runners.spotlight: 40,000gns yearling; first foal; dam unraced half-sister to winners Arabian Light (smart 1m-1m2f), Symbol Of Light (smart 1m/8.6f) and Sapphire Seas (1m2f Listed), out of useful 7f/1m winning half-sister to smart 1m-1m4f winner Elite Army; plenty to like on paper and he needs a close look in market.

runners.comment: Flopped when favourite at Wolverhampton and he needs a transformation on his second start
runners.name: Lorcas Waltz
runners.owner: HM The King & HM The Queen
runners.spotlight: Lope De Vega half-brother to three winners; 9-4 favourite at Wolverhampton (8.6f) three weeks ago but he ran green and finished a remote ninth of 12; should know much more this time but he needs a transformation on his second start.

runners.comment: Has struggled in both his runs and handicaps will be more like it
runners.name: Madjid
runners.owner: Dr Jamal Ahmadzadeh & Mrs D Swinburn
runners.spotlight: Tailed off on Newmarket debut in August and he returned after a gelding operation with another heavy defeat at Lingfield (7f, AW) last month; has stacks to find now upped in trip and handicaps will be more like it.

runners.comment: 175,000gns yearling; interesting newcomer for an in-form stable
runners.name: You Got To My Soul
runners.spotlight: 175,000gns yearling; tenth foal; half-sister to seven winners including Gipoia (1m2f inc Listed; RPR 103), Falcao Negro (8.5f-1m4f including AW/Listed; 102) and Beautiful Bertie (7f/1m AW 2yo; 99); dam 1m AW 2yo winner (74), sister to 1m 2yo Group 1 winner Proud And Regal; interesting newcomer for an in-form stable.

19:30.race_name: Midnite A Next Generation Betting App Handicap

runners.comment: Four-time Tapeta winner and he's a player if he can get back near best; had wind surgery
runners.name: Northern Spirit
runners.owner: Steel A Win & Spring Cottage Syndicate 3
runners.spotlight: Recorded his seventh win when scoring off 2lb lower at Newcastle (5f, AW) in August; creditable efforts in Class 2 events (including over C&D) in next starts and he may have needed his reappearance run at Newcastle last month; had wind surgery since and he's a player if he gets back near best.

runners.comment: Dual C&D winner who was close up at Lingfield on Monday; dangerous if he can back that up
runners.name: Master Of My Fate
runners.owner: Ms Janelle Cao Ross Harmon & Partner
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner who was successful off 2lb higher on turf in June; has been up and down since then but he wasn't beaten far at Lingfield (5f) on Monday and has claims if he can back that up.

runners.comment: Dual course winner who went close off this mark at Lingfield last Saturday; key player
runners.name: Star Chorus
runners.spotlight: Won a Class 4 over C&D in September and he's run well in three of his four subsequent runs including when a close third at Lingfield last Saturday; on same mark here and he's respected back on Tapeta.

runners.comment: On dangerous mark but he needs to turn things around for new yard
runners.name: Moonstone Boy
runners.spotlight: Clearcut winner at Carlisle (5f, good to soft) in May but has form figures of 50009050 since then; now 4lb lower than for his last success but he needs to turn things around for new yard (changed hands for 18,000gns in October); blinkers removed.

runners.comment: Easy win over C&D last month and he ran well over 6f last time; interesting back in trip
runners.name: Ay Gee Ell
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the 12th attempt with an emphatic win over C&D (visor added) last month; held in fourth under a penalty here seven days later but he got pestered for the lead and that was a creditable effort over 6f; another 3lb rise has now kicked in but he still looks feasibly treated on his penultimate form and is an interesting contender back in trip.

runners.comment: All four wins have been over C&D but was disappointing under a penalty here on Tuesday
runners.name: Popular Dream
runners.spotlight: All four wins have been over C&D and latest was off 4lb lower 11 days ago; hit a personal best with that success but this hold-up performer is not easy to predict and was disappointing under a penalty here (fifth of six) on Tuesday; mixed messages.

20:00.race_name: Make The Move To Midnite Handicap

runners.breeder: E A R L Ecurie Haras Du Cadran Et Al
runners.comment: Unplaced in five runs last year but beaten only 2l at Wolverhampton in November.
runners.name: Skycutter
runners.spotlight: Best known as a hurdler/chaser these days; unplaced back on the Flat in five runs last year but beaten only 2l at Wolverhampton (1m4f) in November; has been given a chance by the handicapper if he can show more.

runners.comment: Recorded his second course win in December; third at Lingfield two weeks ago.
runners.name: Mr Nugget
runners.spotlight: Consistent sort who recorded his second course win (1m3f) in December; beaten 1l when third of 11 off this mark at Lingfield (1m4f) two weeks ago and should be in the shake-up.

runners.comment: 0-16; eighth at Wolverhampton three weeks ago following a break.
runners.name: Alnayef
runners.spotlight: 0-16, he has shown bits of form when placed but his latest effort when eighth of 11 at Wolverhampton (1m6f) three weeks ago following a break was discouraging; his mark continues to fall but hard to recommend for win purposes.

runners.comment: Has not been beaten far on his last three starts including when third over C&D last month.
runners.name: Spec Of Light
runners.owner: R G Robinson & R D Robinson
runners.spotlight: Sole success came here (1m) last March off 2lb higher; he has not been beaten far on his last three starts (all here) including when third over C&D last month; cheekpieces now on for the first time and should not be far away.

runners.comment: Beaten a combined 41l in two starts for current yard, latest when last on handicap debut.
runners.name: The Corporate Guy
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in two starts for Gavin Cromwell in the autumn; sold for 7,000gns in October and beaten a combined 41l in two starts for current stable, latest when last of 12 on handicap debut; steps up in trip and big improvement required.

runners.comment: Last of 11 at Goodwood when last seen in October; makes stable debut.
runners.name: Harlington
runners.spotlight: All four wins when trained by Joe Tickle; last of 11 at Goodwood (2m) when last seen; makes stable debut (same owners) off 4lb above his last winning mark and needs to hit the ground running.

runners.comment: All five AW wins have been at this track, three of those over C&D; returns from a break.
runners.name: Lednikov
runners.spotlight: All five AW wins have been at this track, three of those over C&D; third on his last two starts, he has been given a chance by the handicapper but must overcome a six-month absence; market may be best guide.

runners.comment: Scored here last month off 3lb lower mark; not disgraced twice since.
runners.name: Hackney Diamonds
runners.spotlight: Scored here (1m3f) last month off 3lb lower mark; not disgraced at Wolverhampton and Newcastle since and holds place claims at least.

runners.comment: 0-8 on the Flat and held by Hackney Diamonds here last month.
runners.name: Rosco Rogers
runners.spotlight: 0-8 on the Flat and held by Hackney Diamonds here (1m3f) last month; needs to show more.

20:30.race_name: Win 250,000 With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap

runners.comment: 0-7 and has shown little in four starts in handicaps.
runners.name: Tickettothestars
runners.spotlight: 0-7 and has shown little in four starts in handicaps; has dropped another 4lb but not enough to tempt at present.

runners.comment: 0-9 but finished second of eight over C&D 16 days ago off this mark.
runners.name: Mademoiselle Belle
runners.spotlight: 0-9 but finished second of eight over C&D (33-1) 16 days ago off this mark and a repeat of that form would see her go close.

runners.comment: Sixth of eight on AW/handicap debut at Chelmsford last month; needs to show more.
runners.name: Mythical Night
runners.spotlight: Four-race maiden, no improvement for the application of first-time cheekpieces (retained) when sixth of eight on AW/handicap debut at Chelmsford (6f) last month; needs to show more.

runners.comment: Only modest form in three novice/maiden runs but stepping back up to 6f should suit.
runners.name: Al Najashi
runners.spotlight: Only modest form in three novice/maiden runs but stepping back up to 6f should suit and he is open to improvement now handicapping at a low level; one to note for market confidence in first-time tongue-tie.

runners.comment: Ran respectably when favourite for similar event at Chelmsford last time.
runners.name: Woody Y Fernandez
runners.spotlight: Ran respectably in first-time hood (now removed) when favourite for similar event at Chelmsford (6f) last time; comparatively exposed, being 0-9, but is one of the main form contenders; tongue-tie back on.

runners.comment: Won 6f selling nursery at Newcastle in November but unable to follow up there last month.
runners.name: Container Express
runners.spotlight: Landed a 6f selling nursery at Newcastle in November but unable to follow up when fourth of five over 7f back there last month; dropping back to his winning distance may help but he looks vulnerable.

runners.comment: Only modest form in six starts with Charlie Fellowes; makes stable debut off lowly mark.
runners.name: Oh So Perfect
runners.spotlight: Only modest form in six starts with Charlie Fellowes; makes stable debut off lowly mark but hard to recommend unless the market speaks in her favour.

runners.comment: Well held on all four starts, including when ninth over C&D when last seen in September.
runners.name: Trucial Pearl
runners.spotlight: Well held on all four starts, including when ninth of 14 on handicap debut over C&D when last seen in September; best watched.

runners.comment: Well beaten on all three starts at massive odds; handicap debut.
runners.name: Mon Petit Frere
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on all three starts at massive odds; first-time tongue-tie is applied on handicap debut and major improvement required.

runners.comment: Down the field in three runs on turf in autumn; gelded since and makes AW/handicap debut.
runners.name: Second Avenue
runners.spotlight: Down the field in three runs on turf in the autumn; gelded since and makes AW/handicap debut; would be no surprise if he showed significant improvement.

runners.comment: Just moderate form in three runs; makes handicap debut and best watched.
runners.name: Rai Rogers
runners.spotlight: Just moderate form in three runs; makes handicap debut and best watched.
